Senior Data Scientist
You are determined to stay ahead of the latest technologies in Data Science!
We're one of the largest and most advanced Data Science practices in the country
Together we can build state-of-the-art Data Science models that power seamless experiences for millions of customers.
Do work that matters
As a Senior Data Scientist within the Chief Operations Office (COO) Data Science team, you will contribute to the development and management of AI models supporting the Chief Operations Office of the bank. This role involves designing and developing cutting edge AI solutions to uplift operation efficiency and customer experience.

You will work closely with key stakeholders, and cross-functional teams within COO Data Science team and the COO business stakeholders to ensure best customer and business outcomes.
You will come with a strong business acumen along with demonstrable experience in using statistics and machine learning and will be part of a high-performing team of data scientists that concentrates on data models to solve data science problems.
To us, data is everything. It is what powers our cutting-edge features and it’s the reason we can provide seamless experiences for millions of customers from app to branch.
See yourself in our team
The Chief Operations Office (COO) Data Science team is responsible for leading and the delivery of world-class AI and ML capabilities to support the stakeholders in serving our customers. We focus on developing advanced Machine Learning and Generative AI capabilities at CBA, working closely with business teams and analytics communities across the bank. We use data, ML and AI to enhance the financial wellbeing of our customers and communities, and to improve productivity and reduce risk.
As a community, our data scientists have diverse backgrounds and industry experience, with state-of-the-art machine learning research and development expertise, and in-depth knowledge of structured and unstructured data in the Bank. We are open-minded, curious and passionate about problem solving and data driven innovation at scale. In CBA we collaborate with universities and start-ups, hold regular knowledge sharing, technical training and external talks which aid in growing the data science community and industry reputation.
We support our people with the flexibility to balance where work is done with at least half your time each month connecting in office. We also have many other flexible working options available including changing start and finish times, part-time arrangements and job share to name a few. Talk to us about how these arrangements might work for you.
We are seeking people who are:
Passionate about building market leading commercial, machine learning systems that utilise state of the art data science and scoring techniques
Excited about tackling new challenging business problems in Data Science
Adept with using a combination of commercial and technical Data Science models to find unique solutions in adding strategic value to the business
Collaborative in nature to work with product teams, curious enough to solve data problems and courageous in positively influencing senior stakeholders
Natural leaders that enjoy a collaborative environment and want to help foster a positive and inclusive culture that promotes development and growth
Constantly thinking outside the box and breaking boundaries to solve complex data science problems
We are also interested in hearing from people who:
Are able to build and develop ML and AI solution and utilise statistical models to drive business decisions and outcomes
Can collaborate with key business areas, including MLOps teams, Solution Architects and product owners to provide implementable AI and ML solutions and insights to drive engagement and customer satisfaction
Are experienced in working with large and complex data within a corporate environment, and automating processes
Have a natural talent to communicate and positively influence a diverse and large group of stakeholders and cross-functional teams
Tech skills:
We use a broad range of tools, languages, and frameworks. We don’t expect you to know them all but experience or exposure to any ML systems and statistical modelling will set you up for success in this role!
Solid foundations in statistical modelling, Data Science and ML models and Gen AI
Experience in developing and deploying a variety of AI / data science solutions including generative AI, NLP, reinforcement learning
Have coding skills that allow you to build and implement the ML models ideas easily and quickly (R or Python, PySpark, Python, SQL, AWS/ Azure)
Track record of proficient data wrangling skills and efficient large data manipulation
Strong experience in identifying, analysing and prioritising opportunities for AI solutions to achieve the greatest impact
Project management and presentation skills to communicate and keep track of timelines including to other data scientists working on same or similar projects
Degree level qualification in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or similar subjects
Working with us:
Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive, and flexible workplace with an ultimate flexibility to work from any of our engineering hubs within Australia. One where we’re driven by our values, and supported to share ideas, initiatives, and energy. One where making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day.
Here, you’ll thrive. You’ll be supported when faced with challenges and empowered to tackle new opportunities. We’re hiring technology talent from across all of Australia and have opened technology hubs in Sydney, Melbourne and Perth. We really love working here, and we think you will too.
**Apply Now to live your best life, by doing your best work with us! **

Department: GT Onshore
Division: Enterprise Finance
Location: Melbourne
About Us

At ANZ, we're shaping a world where people and communities thrive, driven by a common goal: to improve the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our millions of customers.

About the Role

The Group Treasury Data & Systems Business & Data Analyst will be responsible for supporting new and existing change initiatives related to ANZ Markets Platform Upgrade Program for group’s balance sheet modelling system (OFSAA) from both global liquidity risk management and funds transfer pricing (FTP) perspective. You will be responsible for the end-to-end analysis and on-going support of delivery for that initiative, remediation of existing data quality issue, data mapping and data mining. The role requires candidate to work across an array of stakeholders within Group Treasury as well as various Project and Technology teams within the bank.

Banking is changing and we’re changing with it, giving our people great opportunities to try new things, learn and grow. Whatever your role at ANZ, you’ll be building your future, while helping to build ours.

Role Location: 833 Collins Street, Docklands VIC 3008

Role Type: 12 Month Fixed Term Contract / Secondment, Full-time

What will your day look like?

As the Group Treasury Data & Systems Business & Data Analyst, you will will be accountable for acting as the OFSAA Business Solution SME for assigned Change initiatives providing specialised on-going support and guidance to both upstream and downstream applications and systems throughout the delivery lifecycle.

This role has a focus on ensuring GT D&S meets Enterprise Data Governance standards through effective implementation of data management practises as well as identifying opportunities for continuous improvement of data quality, operational efficiencies and reporting of these metrics.

What will you bring?

To grow and be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following:

Knowledge of business analysis processes, demonstrate ability to document and communicate data quality findings effectively and provide key insights to stakeholders

Experience in planning and managing communications spanning planning, sequencing, key messages, cross system engagement to ensure my target audience is informed. I am a passionate communicator and possess problem solving skills, with the ability to use insights to influence key decisions

Ability to build and maintain positive relationships and influence with stakeholders at all levels and can use consulting methods to facilitate perspectives and insights.

Experience in successfully delivering solutions within complex large scale data processing environments and can recognize the common challenges and adapt accordingly to ensure high quality outcomes.

Exposure to applications/solutions leveraging data warehousing concepts; with the ability to analyse and solve complex problems using a range of techniques Applications/solutions including SQL.

Experience with agile project delivery, and a proficiency in using tools to manage projects effectively – whether it’s Excel, Jira, Confluence, SharePoint

Experience with Group Treasury Solutions, OFSAA (Oracle Financial Services Analytical Application), Regulatory Reporting, Funds Transfer Pricing or Markets Products is desirable

You’re not expected to have 100% of these skills. At ANZ a growth mindset is at the heart of our culture, so if you have most of these things in your toolbox, we’d love to hear from you.

So why join us?

From the moment you join ANZ, you'll be doing meaningful work that will shape a world where people and communities thrive.

But it's not just our customers who'll feel your impact. you'll feel it too. Because at ANZ, you'll have the resources, opportunities, and support you need to take the next big step in your career.

We're a diverse bunch at ANZ in different roles, different locations, doing different things. That's why we have a range of flexible working arrangements, so our people can 'make work, work for them'. We also provide a range of benefits including access to health and wellbeing services and discounts on selected products and services from ANZ and more.

At ANZ, you'll be part of an organisation where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated. That's because we're committed to building a workplace that reflects the diversity of the communities we serve. We welcome applications from everyone and encourage you to talk to us about any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability or access requirement, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.

. You can apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and searching for reference number 74901.

Edith Cowan University

People and Culture in partnership with Digital Campus Services will soon commence a major project to migrate our Payroll System “Ascender Pay” to a managed hosted platform and upgrade to the latest version.

We are seeking two (2) Senior Business Analysts full time for a fixed term of 12months for the duration of this project.

One position will work within the project team, the second position will backfill the current Senior Business Analyst who is seconded to the project.

These full-time fixed term Senior Business Analyst positions within the People and Culture team attract remuneration of $115,042 to $129,573 (HEW 8) plus 17% University superannuation contribution.

Kapsch TrafficCom is a market leading, global provider of intelligent transportation systems (ITS) in the segments of toll collection, traffic management, safety and security, smart urban mobility and connected vehicles.
Our core business is to design, build and operate electronic toll collection systems for multi-lane free-flow traffic. With our end-to-end solutions, we cover the entire value creation chain of our customers as a one-stop shop, from components and subsystems to their integration and operation.
Us
Kapsch is a household name in Austria and is one of Austria's most successful technology companies. Founded in 1892, we are a family-owned company with our global headquarters in Vienna. With 130 years’ experience and a keen eye on the future, the Kapsch Group invests approximately ten percent of annual revenues back into research and development to ensure constant innovation and a steady stream of new technologies for the benefit of our customers around the world.
Kapsch TrafficCom creates innovative hardware and software solutions for sustainable mobility to enable users to arrive at their destination conveniently, on time, safely, efficiently, and with minimal environmental impact. Throughout the entire value chain we focus on sustainability and find ways to reduce the impact of transport on the environment.
Our Culture
Kapsch is a values-driven organization and we work closely as a team. We are a learning organization that invests in our employees’ development through various learning platforms. We work as a team where collaboration and information sharing is a way of life.
At Kapsch, we are an Equal Opportunity Employer and we promote diversity and inclusion. We are committed to building a workforce that represents the communities in which we live and operate. Our culture thrives on mutual respect, responsibility, professionalism, and dynamism while working together as a team towards achieving our goals. We give our employees the opportunity to grow and develop their careers through continuous learning.
The Role
We have an exciting opportunity to join our Melbourne team! We are seeking a proactive Office Administrator to provide administrative support to the Sales and Finance teams, office management duties, and be responsible for Reception in the Melbourne office.
Your typical day will comprise meeting and greeting visitors on arrival, handling incoming and outgoing couriers, maintaining our communal office spaces so there is fruit in the kitchen, milk in the fridge, and snacks for our Social Fridays. Each month you will help the Sales team with data entry for their systems, and the Finance team with data entry for theirs, but don’t worry – there will be someone to guide and help you. You will be the liaison with our building manager, our external cleaners, and our travel provider. You will have ad-hoc duties such as helping arrange our internal activities, and providing general administrative support to the business. Of course there is more, but nothing you can’t handle!
You
You are an outgoing, energetic, team player who is looking for a role where you can really help our business thrive as the cheerful face that greets our visitors and a supportive team member who isn’t afraid to roll up your sleeves when needed. You have experience in Reception and Administration roles, a can-do attitude, and a willingness to learn.
On Offer
Job stability working with a Global Company;
Part Time: 4 times per week in the office (Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday and Friday).
Opportunity to grow with great training opportunities;
Down to earth, honest, and open team;
Annual Birthday Leave day;
Annual Special Leave day in December;
Access to EAP and Wellness Activities;
Online Learning and access to LinkedIn Learning;
Company-sponsored social activities.

The Role
Do you see yourself as a Business Intelligence Manager?
Are you a leader who can present unique insights to Senior Leaders?
Ever wanted to work in a great team in the strategic centre of Defence?

If you have answered yes, then this is the role for you.

Enterprise Transformation and Governance Division is at the heart of Defence’s strategic centre and supports the Associate Secretary to integrate, transform and govern the work of Defence.

This work is underpinned by the foundational reform principles outlined in the 2024 National Defence Strategy: simplification, workforce optimisation and digitisation. We are looking for experienced business intelligence analysts and governance professionals who have a genuine interest in transforming the way Defence performs as we implement the 2024 National Defence Strategy.

You will have the opportunity to work at the strategic centre of Defence, engaging with stakeholders across every Group and Service. Deliver strategic insights that inform senior decision makers, helping to solve challenges and shape prioritisation and performance.

At the EL1 level, you will:
Play a central role in Defence’s transformation, leading work to simplify, optimise and digitise.
Bring your team and stakeholders across Defence on the transformation journey, building commitment to the continuous improvement of the organisation through the use of business intelligence insights.
Be accountable for complex planning and analysis activities on organisational priorities and performance, distil critical insights, and use data visualisation techniques to present complex data simply.
Collaborate on complex across Defence and harness diverse skillsets to shape and guide innovative approaches to data informed decisions.

About our Team
The Enterprise Transformation and Governance Division has three Branches; Enterprise Evaluation Branch, Enterprise Transformation Branch and Enterprise Governance Branch. Vacancies currently exist in several directorates within Enterprise Evaluation Branch.
The Directorate of Enterprise Performance and Reporting delivers the Defence Annual Report and is leading the transformation of Defence’s performance measurement to support senior leader decision making and public transparency.
The Directorate of Enterprise Planning and Priorities delivers the Defence Corporate Plan and is aligning planning and priorities with the 2024 National Defence Strategy.
The Directorate of Enterprise Intelligence provides strategic insights to inform decisions and achieve Defence priorities.
The Enterprise Concepts Directorate supports the understanding of Enterprise-wide challenges and the development of options for resolution.
The Enterprise Risk and Continuity Directorate supports Defence to maintain an appropriate system of risk management and business continuity to support our capability and critical functions.

Our Ideal Candidate
If you are an innovative, agile and transformative leader, we want to talk to you.

To be successful in this role you will have:
Exceptional stakeholder engagement skills.
A high level of business intelligence, digital literacy and data visualisation skills.
Strong data analysis and evaluation skills to provide decision support advice to Senior Leaders.
A proven ability to think strategically and take action to deliver outcomes.
Demonstrated ability to collaborate and build new skill sets in existing teams.
Experience in planning, performance or governance for a complex organisation.
Excellent written and verbal communications skills.

Be part of the Centre for Automotive Safety Research and contribute to our long history of saving lives and reducing harm through a range of diverse and challenging research fields.
Conduct applied research that makes a difference to communities locally and around the world.
The Centre for Automotive Safety Research (CASR) at the University of Adelaide is a world class multi-disciplinary research centre that seeks to reduce the injury and economic burden of road crashes. Core activities include crash investigation, vehicle testing, data analysis, modelling and evaluation. The Centre provides opportunities that are both interesting and challenging, and allows individuals to contribute to work that can lead to profound impacts on communities. CASR is currently seeking a person with expertise in manipulating and analysing large datasets for research purposes.
To be successful, you will need:
A tertiary degree or higher in a related field.
Demonstrated experience in the analysis of datasets (desirably, though not necessarily, including datasets that are imperfect and obtained from a variety of sources).
Demonstrable communication skills including fluency in written and spoken English along with an ability to communicate scientific concepts via reports, publications, and presentations to a diverse range of audiences.
A strong work ethic, and the ability to work well independently, and as a member of a broader team (including with external partners).
The ability to adapt to different research topics, understand the objectives of multiple active projects, and to dynamically prioritise contributions to achieve deadlines.
This position requires a valid National Police Check.
Enjoy an outstanding career environment
The Centre for Automotive Safety Research resides within the Faculty of Sciences, Engineering and Technology at the University of Adelaide.

Our culture is one that welcomes all and embraces diversity consistent with our Staff Values and Behaviour Framework and our Values of integrity, respect, collegiality, excellence and discovery. We firmly believe that our people are our most valuable asset, so we work to grow and diversify the skills, knowledge and capability of all our staff.

In addition, we offer a wide range of attractive staff benefits. These include: salary packaging; flexible work arrangements; high-quality professional development programs and activities; and an on-campus health clinic, gym and other fitness facilities.

Outstanding Experiences. Infinite Opportunities.

Here in the Riverina, we treasure your skills and experience and we’re ready to roll out the red carpet to welcome you to town and we’ve prepared oodles of goodies to help you settle in.
When you join our team here at MLHD, you unlock priority access to a broad range of interesting and unique learning and development opportunities where you can quickly advance your skills. With this advanced skill acquisition and experience comes fast-tracked career progression; the sky’s the limit to how far you can go!

Why You’ll Fit Right In.
You have a good sense of adventure and are willing to try new things. We’re looking for open-minded leaders who take a systematic approach to their work, have strong critical thinking skills and are passionate.
What you'll be doing
The Business Analyst and Data Steward has high level accountability and responsibility for Murrumbidgee Local Health District (MLHD) meeting its NSWH performance reporting obligations.
The incumbent will enhance the understanding and engagement of facility based senior managers and clinical staff of the importance of accurate data capture and local facility understanding of the impact of changed activity, complexity both in terms of services delivery and also financial implications to facilities in an Activity Based Funding (ABF) and Management environment.
The incumbent is a member of the Performance Team which has responsibility for providing high quality information and advice essential to informing the LHD’s patient management and service planning and the optimisation of funding within an ABF framework.
The management of the ABF data streams contributes to the accuracy of the high priority performance indicators in the annual Service Agreement between MLHD and NSWH. This includes the management of data and data systems to ensure the integrity and reliability of the information and reports.
This role has principal responsibility, as Data Steward for a nominated ABF data stream, for the extraction of data and provision of high level analyses and consultation with facility managers and clinicians (VMO, staff doctors and senior nursing staff) with respect to patient activity and performance reporting in this activity stream.
The incumbent will provide high level leadership and technical advice and maintain knowledge of the ABF data streams sufficient to support the function and operation of the Data Steward positions within the Performance and Activity team.
This incumbent will in addition to consultation and education processes provide activity reports and performance results to inform the performance framework and enable the accurate projection of targets to inform MLHD Executive staff activity and funding negotiations with the Ministry of Health.
The incumbent will be required to undertaken occasional travel to MLHD sites and on occasions attend meetings in Sydney (NSWH). On some occasions these duties will require overnight stays.
Learn more about the role and requirements here.

Job Description
$107,811 - $119,457.63 p/a + Superannuation
24-month max term contract
Be part of an exciting Digital Transformation
Hume City Council is one of Australia’s fastest growing and culturally diverse councils. We put the customer and our community at the centre of all that we do, ensuring our services are efficient and accessible.
We are seeking a passionate, collaborative Business Analyst to drive process improvement and service transformation enabled through our Digital Transformation Program (Program). The role will initially focus on establishing future state visions for the services and processes in scope of the initiative, later collaborating with our implementation partners and process owners to identify business rules and requirements to enable the configuration of our enabling technology.
What you’ll be doing
Ensure the services and processes in scope of the program meets the needs of our customers and community, are owned by the business, enabling the improvement of both our customers and employee experience.
Document process maps, service, and process visions to enable timely and effective decision making during the delivery stage of the program.
Working with our implementation partners and the business define service and process detailed functional and non-functional requirements to inform the configuration of our enabling technology, validating how these needs are being met throughout the programs lifecycle.
Working collaboratively with our Process and Services Owners, Subject Matter experts, Customer Experience, and Organisational Performance and Strategy Divisions, define future state visions and challenges for the services and processes in scope in preparation for the configuration of our enabling technology.
Working collaboratively with our implementation partners, Process and Service Owners, identify the business rules and requirements to inform the configuration of our enabling technology, developing and maintaining detailed documentation of business requirements, processes, and functional specifications.
Ensure the configuration of the enabling technology adheres to the program’s principles, meeting our customer and user needs, whilst ensuring that Council’s legislative and regulatory requirements are being met.
Ensure reporting requirements are supported by the transformation of our processes and services to be realised through the configuration of the technology to support effective decision making and Councils continual improvement.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify impacts to our operating model, customers, and users to support effective change management and training activities.
The skills and experience you’ll bring to the role:
Experience in understanding stakeholder issues and challenges and devising improvements through business analysis methods.
Experience in applying Business Analysis methodologies, such as BABoK, and the delivery of information technology-enabled services.
Demonstrated knowledge and experience in the development, implementation, and review of innovative solutions to enhance service outcomes.
An understanding of Technology One’s OneCouncil Software as a Service (SaaS) Ci Anywhere Enterprise Resource Planning solution would be desirable.
Why Hume City Council?
A leader in local government, we’re committed to creating an inclusive and collaborative work environment that is guided by our values:
We’re better, every day: We give things a go and value progress over perfection. We have permission to go for it and are expected to reflect and learn.
We’re in it together: At Hume, everyone matters. We Welcome and include all. Respect and safety are expected.
We show up: We empower and trust others and own our work. We rise to the challenges and are expected to do what we say we will.
All for Hume: We strive to achieve our best for the Hume Community. We are proud and passionate about working towards better outcomes and expect they are at the centre of everything we do.
We offer a competitive salary package, professional development opportunities, and a supportive work environment.
A child safe organisation and an equal opportunity employer. Council encourages people of all ages, people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and people from culturally diverse backgrounds to apply.
All candidates will be required to undertake background and probity checks including Reference Checks, Working with Children Check, and a Criminal Record Check.

Company Description

Nine is Australia’s largest locally owned media company – the home of Australia’s most trusted and loved brands spanning News, Sport, Lifestyle, and Entertainment. We pride ourselves on creating the best content, accessed by consumers when and how they want – across Publishing, Broadcasting and Digital.
Nine’s assets include the 9Network, major mastheads such as The Sydney Morning Herald, The Age and The Australian Financial Review, radio stations 2GB, 3AW, 4BC and 6PR, digital properties such as nine.com.au, 9Now, 9Honey, Pedestrian.TV, Drive, subscription video platform Stan and a majority investment in Domain Group.
Our purpose is to shape culture by sparking conversations, challenging perspectives, and entertaining our communities.We bring people together by celebrating the big occasions and connecting the everyday moments. Australia belongs here. We bring our purpose to life via three shared values: We walk the talk, turn over every stone and keep it human.

Job Description

The Data Platform team designs, builds, and maintains the tooling and cloud infrastructure for our data teams, enabling data-informed decision making, highly engaging consumer experiences and effective commercial products.
Our team’s focus is on creating scalable, reusable apps that support core data engineering activities, including workflow orchestration, data transformation, and integrations. We also develop automations and guardrails to enhance data engineering productivity, security, long-term maintainability, ensure quality and improve our operational resilience.
We strive for a safe, collaborative and fun engineering culture that values innovation, quality, and continuous improvement.

Qualifications

Role Responsibilities
Assist in building, enhancing, and maintaining data platform tools and improving the use of cloud infrastructure.
Contribute to solution designs, architectures, and the development of standards and practices.
Fous on observability, monitoring and alerting across the platform and tools to ensure system health, minimise issues and proactively identify and resolve issues when they do happen.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders, including data engineers, product managers, data scientists, analysts, and business users to understand and support their data platform needs
Communicate technical concepts and solutions effectively to stakeholders with different levels of technical understanding.
Demonstrate good engineering practices and behaviours
Enthusiastic, be able to contribute and learn from wider engineering talent in the team
Stay updated with emerging data engineering technologies and trends, and evaluate their potential benefits to Nine’s data platform.
Essential qualifications, experience & skills
Proficieny in at least one programming language (e.g. Python, Java)
Understanding of good software quality principles, including DRY, unit testing, code reviews, and continuous integration practices.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to troubleshoot data and technology issues.
Comfortable with Git for version control, including tasks like branching, merging and conflict resolution.
Desirable qualifications, experience & skills
A bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, software engineering, data engineering, data science, information technology or a related field.
Experience with a data processing framework like Apache Spark (including PySpark).
Knowledge of some of the key data tools or frameworks used at Nine, such as DBT, Apache Airflow, Apache Spark, GCP, BigQuery.
Familiarity with containerisation (Docker) for creating, managing and deploying applications.
Experience with SQL and database technologies
Understanding of data warehouse modelling approaches to meet product and business requirements.
Experience working with Cloud Platforms, including services for data storage, processing, and analytics.
Experience with cloud deployment and test automation using a CI/CD solution such as Cloud Build or Concourse
Experience in deploying and managing cloud infrastructure as code (IaC) using Terraform or similar

Additional Information

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion:
At Nine, we are committed to fostering a workforce that embraces all aspects of diversity and inclusion and where practices are equitable to ensure our people experience a sense of belonging. From day one, you'll be encouraged to bring your whole self to work and will be supported to perform at your best. Should you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application.
We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities, and of all ages, nationalities, backgrounds and cultures.
Disclaimer: Nine does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Nine is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
Work rights: Please note to apply for this role you must already have the right to lawfully work and live in Australia.

About the job Data Portfolio Head
Job Description:
The Data Program is one of our customers strategic programs which has been recently established to help deliver our ambitious strategy by delivery of a business-wide data strategy and data transformation program. You will work with internal & customer colleagues to shape the strategic thinking, bring to life and deliver key strategic projects that will establish data and analytics capabilities across all parts of the customers business.

Your new role

Reporting to the Customer Delivery Manager this is a leadership role within the Data Program to help lead and deliver large scale data & analytics project outcomes across all business units of the company.

The successful candidate will have proven expertise in leading data, analytics, digital or similar transformation projects and business change. They will be responsible for the end-to-end delivery of one or more projects in the data program with a focus on time, cost, quality and benefits.

Key Responsibilities include:

Project planning

Supports the customer and project director in the development of a business case

Determines the objectives and measures upon which the project will be evaluated at its completion, with a particular focus on benefits

Creates a detailed work plan in the PPM (Portfolio Planning Management) tool which identifies and sequences the activities needed to successfully complete the project (including implementation into BAU so the anticipated project benefits will be delivered)

Determines the resources (time, money, equipment, etc.) required to complete the project.

Reviews the project schedule with senior management and all other staff that will be affected by the project activities; revises the schedule as required.

Conducts Impact Assessments of projects scope across Privacy, AML/CTF, Security, Data Governance, Business Continuity Management





Project implementation

Ensures the project meets sponsor expectations with respect to quality, budget, delivery timelines, and strategy.

Adheres to the customers project management methodology.

Oversee’s Project Execution & ensures all projects run according to the project plan.

Documents information in PPM to ensure that all project information is appropriately documented and secured.

Works effectively with project team members to execute the plan successfully.

Works with external parties to ensure the delivery of quality outcomes whilst building a strong rapport and trust, and facilitating a positive experience in dealing with the Fund

Applies effective change management methodologies and techniques in the successful implementation of projects.

Monitors the progress of the project and make adjustments as necessary to ensure the successful completion of the project.

Identifies, tracks, manages and mitigates risk on specific projects.

Reviews the quality of the work completed with the project team on a regular basis to ensure that it meets the project standards.





Project reporting and control

Ensures that all projects are delivered within the agreed cost parameters and that all changes to project budgets, time and scope occur in accordance with the accepted change management processes.

Monitors and controls performance against planning, providing reports to Steering Committees, the Project Management Office, Project Governance Panel and the Fund management as required.

Reports on project quality, project sponsor and project success metrics during regularly scheduled and ad hoc portfolio review meetings with the Heads & Directors from the Customer.

Manages the costs within the project budgets.

Manages scope creep through change orders, phased delivery or other methods to ensure projects deliver on timeline, scope, budget and strategy expectations.

Highlights issues in a timely manner to management that may adversely affect the successful delivery of the project.

Where project control is in jeopardy, creates contingency plans with appropriate input from key team members (including the PMO) and implements a revised project schedule, scope or budget in a timely manner.

Project communication

Sets and manages project expectations.

Establishes a communication schedule to update stakeholders on the progress of the project.

Manages day-to-day project sponsor and stakeholder interactions.

Uses sound judgment in all project communication and ensures that key stakeholders including the team, sponsor and management are apprised of project activities in a timely manner.

Communicates progress, risks, expectations, timelines, milestones and other key project metrics to sponsors and team members.

Assists and supports the development of project skills within the organization, through the provision of advice and coaching of staff, as required.

Project evaluation

Evaluates all key project deliverables, as well as final product to ensure traceability of requirements, high quality and sponsor acceptance.

Undertakes post implementation reviews and benefits realisation exercises as required.





What you'll need

Significant experience as a senior project manager in a complex organization, preferably delivering enterprise-wide data, analytics, digital or similar transformation

Experience delivering projects on any public clouds like Google etc.

Strong experience working with (any) agile frameworks within cross-functional agile projects

Proven ability to work to a structured delivery framework.

Skillful application of well-designed change management and communication processes as they relate to instigating and delivering on programs of change.

Significant experience in working under pressure, setting and manage conflicting priorities and meeting specified timeframes.

Developed stakeholder relationship skills, including ability to initiate, maintain and develop relationships with staff from all levels of the customer Organisation.

High level facilitation skills and capable management of group dynamics that lead to the effective facilitation, guidance and negotiation of successful outcomes.

Ability to formulate reports and to provide well considered options for deliberation by management.

Developed written and oral communication/ interpersonal skills with the ability to present ideas, perspectives and issues to senior management.

Demonstrated ability and a willingness to highlight to management any project issues and variations.

Demonstrated ability to collaborate and to be flexible and adaptable

Job Title: Data Solutions Support Specialist - Bentley Systems Pty Ltd
Job Description:
The Company
Seequent builds world-leading subsurface software, helping create a better understanding of the earth to ensure a better world for all.

We are constantly evolving at the forefront of technology to transform how geo-professionals work, eliminating barriers to understanding by connecting software, teams, and the tools they need.

Every day, our customers in over 100 countries work to develop mineral resources more sustainably, design and build better infrastructure, protect the environment, source renewable energy, and help resolve historical challenges such as groundwater contamination and ageing infrastructure.

Our integrated earth modelling, geo-data management, and team collaboration software enables them to see a more complete picture of the earth: because with more understanding comes better decisions – for people and the planet.

Headquartered in New Zealand with global reach, Seequent is the specialist subsurface software company within Bentley Systems. Together, we are helping build a more resilient world.

We’re a high growth, people-centric success story.

Seequent is a Bentley Systems company, working together to build a better future.

The Role:
Seequent has ambitious plans to continue expanding around the globe by developing new innovative solutions to lead the market in geoscience modelling and data management. Many of these solutions are critical to the operations of our customers, and we are looking for a Technical Support Analyst with the drive to ensure that Seequent can exceed our customers’ expectations.
You will provide hands-on technical support to ensure that customer inquiries are handled professionally, efficiently, and in a timely manner. The role is focused on our data management solutions, primarily Imago and MX Deposit. However, there will be an opportunity to gain a base line understanding of our other geology, geophysics, and geotechnical engineering solutions as you may be required to help support other segments from time-to-time.
Tasks & responsibilities:
Liaise directly with customers to provide accurate and timely resolutions to their inquiries, primarily by email, or remote sessions.
Prioritise and triage technical support requests based on the issues presented.
Contribute to the creation of structured, re-usable content for the knowledge base.
Collaborate with the Data Solutions Team to develop onboarding and training content.
Assist in the creation of Self- Help content such as quick start guides, learning paths, and On-Demand Training materials.
Contribute to the design and build of effective global, cross-functional resources to maintain agreed services levels affordably and effectively.

Qualifications and experience required:
Relevant Tertiary Qualification in Data Management, Computer Science, or related field preferred.
2-3 years’ experience in a customer focused Database Management, IT, or Application Support role.
Knowledge of programming languages including Python and/or C#
Proficiency in reporting tools (Power BI and Pentaho), rest API tools (Postman)
Experience in working with various types of geological datasets
Experience in troubleshooting web application communication using browser inspectors.
An interest in the automation of data processes and how this can improve business efficiencies.
Highly developed customer service orientation and excellent English language communication skills.
Excellent analytical, trouble-shooting, and problem-solving skills with a focus on quickly identifying and resolving customer issues.
Experience working with various types of geological datasets is an advantage.
Research shows that some individuals, particularly women and underrepresented groups, are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every single criterion. If you don't think your experience perfectly aligns, or you don't tick all the boxes, please don't rule yourself out! Seequent are committed to hiring a diverse team and encourage individuals of all background and abilities to apply.
Why you will enjoy working with us...
You will be joining a highly skilled, highly productive team of technical experts who are passionate about what we do. We are a friendly, intelligent, and supportive bunch and are looking forward to you bringing your expertise to the team. Our wider team is geographically diverse and from multi-disciplines, so even though you will be based in Vancouver, you will have opportunity to work with colleagues from across the globe.

If you join the Seequent family you will enjoy a fast paced and dynamic environment, exciting challenges, and a variety of tasks. You will have access to ongoing professional development opportunities, and we offer market competitive salaries. So, if you want to help us continue our growth and success while having the opportunity to exercise your passion and expertise, then we would

Inclusion + Diversity
In addition to being dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diverse talent, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience.
If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs. Please provide details in your cover letter of any accommodations needed.

If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs. Please provide details in your cover letter of any accommodations needed.

Company Description

Let’s create a more sociable future together
At Endeavour, we’re totally into what we do. With a portfolio that includes Dan Murphy’s, BWS, ALH Hotels, Pinnacle Drinks and more, we love to bring people together. Together we share our passion for our products and industry; it’s what inspires us to dream big, and continue to create new experiences for our customers and teams across Australia. If you thrive on positive energy, we want to meet you!

Job Description
Bring your passion and feel the energy
We offer flexibility, hybrid/remote working - we value our people
Team discounts across Endeavour Group
This is an exciting and fast-paced opportunity for an experienced Business Analyst (BA) in the Smart Rostering & Forecasting squad within our Advanced Analytics tribe. This is a pivotal role in delivering smart demand forecasting solutions by harnessing the latest techniques & methodology, to contribute meaningfully to our Advanced Analytics vision of “An Endeavour where data and AI fuel people across the group to create our more sociable future”
This is a great opportunity for a BA who is comfortable working with, or willing to upskill in, the building blocks of software development with exposure to advanced analytical tools & techniques in an agile delivery framework. In addition to the role's core, we encourage ideas for continuous improvement, whether it’s elevating efficiencies, collaboration, or inclusivity.
Sound good? Read on.
Here is a taster of what you can expect in this role

Collaboration
Discussing with the Product Manager and/or Delivery Lead to align on priorities and needs throughout the day, formulate the squad backlog, and/or design squad or term planning events
Curious and collaborative conversations with business SMEs or stakeholders to understand the user value of solving problems and opportunities in the current state
Evaluation, analysis, and communication of business requirements captured in clear documentation, showcasing current and future state processes
Engagement with the Subject matter experts to understand user desires and further enable UX concepts and prototypes in line with business requirements
Facilitation
Facilitating backlog refinement with the squad, leveraging a high level understanding of advanced analytics tools and software development
Identifying emerging squad needs, and facilitating access to the right stakeholders, end users, or resources to answer them
Identifying and proposing squad process enhancements to elevate efficiencies, collaboration, or inclusivity
Creative ways to facilitate process transformation from 'As Is' to 'To Be' through diverse methods of workshops and ideation sessions, ensuring successful outcomes via collaborative stakeholder engagement and effective communication.
Documentation
Creating and refining epics and stories aligned to customer and business problems, including user stories, functional and non-functional requirements, and acceptance criteria
Strong in Process mapping & process re-engineering aiming for lean process efficiencies

Qualifications

Now let’s talk about you

Proven business analysis experience with customer front of mind
Trusted collaborator; a partnership mindset that values opinions and facilitates progress towards outcomes, while also challenging and validating opinion
Strong documentation skills; able to create detailed and effective user stories, requirements, acceptance criteria, and process maps
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and resolve data-related issues.
Solid technical background, with the ability to collaborate effectively with data engineers.
Strong communicator; able to develop relationships using sharp communication skills and an enthusiastic, positive attitude
Comfort and familiarity with an agile product mindset

Additional Information

The benefits are good too!
We offer flexible working in every sense
An exclusive discount card for BWS, Dan Murphy’s, Woolworths, BIG W and other Endeavour Group brands, including our ALH pubs
Monthly meeting-free days
Your health and wellbeing is your most important asset, and as one of our valued team members, it’s our first priority. You will have a range of free services to help you live well and support your physical, mental and financial wellbeing
Endeavour Group is full of opportunities - use our dedicated learning and development options to grow an idea, yourself, and your career. This is just the start, so dream big.
At Endeavour, we value being a workplace where everyone’s welcome - if you meet a number of the requirements (and not all), we encourage you to apply.

We are together creators
With a portfolio that includes Dan Murphy’s, BWS, ALH Hotels, Pinnacle Drinks and more, Endeavour Group is big on sociability. Together we create the moments that bring millions of people together. And together we have more fun, create more opportunities, and score a lot more goals. We’re serious about creating a safe, inclusive and fun place to rock up to where equal opportunity is key, and flexibility is part of how we roll.
We’re all about creating a more sociable future - for our customers and each other. If this job excites you - and you’re close-enough on the requirements, reach out, we’d love to hear from you.
You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn or at endeavourgroupcareers.com.au.
Our Talent Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Endeavour Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
#WeAreTogetherCreators #ComeAsYouAre #DreamBig #FeelTheEnergy #LeaveYourMark #EndeavourGroup

Job title Senior Data Warehouse Developer Designation Administrative Officer 7

Job type Full time Duration Ongoing

Salary $113,938 - $122,574 Location Darwin

Position number 34913 RTF 303910 Closing 10/09/2024

Contact officer Aaron Griffin on 08 8999 1512 or aaron.griffin@nt.gov.au

About the agency https://dcdd.nt.gov.au/

Apply online https://jobs.nt.gov.au/Home/JobDetails?rtfId=303910

APPLICATIONS MUST INCLUDE A ONE-PAGE SUMMARY ABOUT YOU, A DETAILED RESUME AND COPIES OF YOUR

TERTIARY QUALIFICATIONS.

Information for applicants – inclusion and diversity and Special Measures recruitment plans

The NTPS values diversity. The NTPS encourages people from all diversity groups to apply for vacancies and accommodates

people with disability by making reasonable workplace adjustments. If you require an adjustment for the recruitment process or

job, please discuss this with the contact officer. For more information about applying for this position and the merit process, go

to the OCPE website.

Aboriginal applicants will be granted priority consideration for this vacancy. For more information on Special Measures plans, go

to the OCPE website.

Primary objective

Provide expert technical and architectural advice on the design and implementation of complex data warehouse solutions. Support

the data warehouse manager to ensure that the Data Warehouse Services unit meets the strategic data requirements and

operational service delivery obligations of the Department of Corporate and Digital Development client agencies.

Context statement

The Data Warehouse function sits within Data Services and more broadly, the Department of Corporate and Digital Development,

Digital Services team. It comprises a number of smaller teams that support different government agencies.

Key duties and responsibilities

1. Provide expert advice on the analysis, interpretation and utilisation of data held within various client agency Enterprise Data

Warehouse environments.

2. Design and implement data warehouse solutions, including data modelling and of assessment of technology platforms, to

optimise delivery of business outcomes.

3. Effectively liaise with stakeholders, including agency specific business units and external parties, to discover, collate and

document data and reporting requirements.

4. Develop, administer and support the extraction, verification, transformation and load processes which populate various client

agency data warehouses.

5. Participate and be a lead technical resource in Data Warehouse project initiatives, including the supervision of junior team

members.

6. Management of designated projects.

Selection criteria

Essential

1. Extensive knowledge and demonstrated experience in the design and development of contemporary data warehouses

including data modelling and ETL job design and extraction patterns.

2. Demonstrated knowledge and experience in systems analysis and design covering user requirements, functional and

technical specifications, data modelling, construction, and implementation.

3. Demonstrated knowledge and experience in effectively managing multiple complex projects in a Data Warehouse context,

including researching complex issues, evaluating options, achieving outcomes within agreed timeframes and providing

appropriate advice to senior management.

4. Extensive experience in the design, coding, testing, maintaining and documentation of computer programs, with an emphasis

on Data Warehouse Extract Transform Load (ETL) programming.

5. Demonstrated work ethic and attitude which emulates the Department’s values of professionalism, accountability, honesty,

innovation and respectfulness.

Desirable

1. Relevant tertiary qualifications in Data related field of study

Further Information

1. The recommended applicant will be required to undergo a criminal history check prior to selection being confirmed. A criminal

history will not exclude an applicant from this position unless it is a relevant criminal history.

To support the successful delivery of ERM projects and objectives by:
Provide technical consulting skills to support the growth of ERM’s service offerings using ESRI's full suite of desk and cloud-based geospatial applications.
On a daily basis provide GIS mapping support for reports and proposals.
Provide geospatial planning and support for field activities associated with environmental, social, and sustainability projects.
Data entry and management including spatial and non-spatial data
Work within quality/budget/schedule expectations and scope-specific assignments.
Complete work assignments in accordance with ERM's management system, format and quality standards.

REQUIREMENTS:
BS or Master’s degree in a relevant discipline.
1+ years of GIS experience.
Experience with producing high quality map outputs using the full suite of ESRI software (ArcPro or ArcMap) is required.
Experience in working with databases.
Experience working on multidisciplinary approvals projects would be advantageous.
Effective written/verbal communication and organization/analytical skills.
Attention to detail, ability to multi-task, maintain flexibility, and works independently with minimal supervision.
Exceptional teamwork and relationship building skills.
Previous consulting experience would be advantageous but is not essential.
High appreciation and understanding of Health & Safety standards
Additional skills that are desirable but not essential include:
ArcGIS web app/widget development
Experience with ArcGIS automation
Feature Manipulation Engine (FME) experience
CAD/12D/Revit experience (basic level)
Any knowledge of or experience working with the EQuIS software suite

Who We Are:
As the world’s leading sustainability consulting firm, ERM is uniquely positioned to contribute to the environment and society through the expertise and energy of our employees worldwide. Sustainability is what we do, and is at the heart of both our service offerings and how we operate our business. For our people, our vision means attracting, inspiring, developing and rewarding our people to work with the best clients and on the biggest challenges, thus creating valuable careers. We achieve our vision in a sustainable manner by maintaining and living our ERM values that include Accountability, Caring for our People, Client Focus, Collaboration, Empowerment, and Transparency.

ERM does not accept recruiting agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, ERM employees or any other company location. ERM is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

ERM is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status or disability status.

Thank you for your interest in ERM.

Information for applicants – inclusion and diversity and Special Measures recruitment plans

The NTPS values diversity. The NTPS encourages people from all diversity groups to apply for vacancies and accommodates

people with disability by making reasonable workplace adjustments. If you require an adjustment for the recruitment

process or job, please discuss this with the contact officer. For more information about applying for this position and the

merit process, go to the OCPE website.

Aboriginal applicants will be granted priority consideration for this vacancy. For more information on Special Measures

plans, go to the OCPE website.

Primary objective

Provide focused technical services related to geospatial data creation, as well as maintenance, updates, and quality control

of data sets. The position administers geospatial data with a focus on the quality and integrity of geospatial data sets to

support effective, informed, and timely decision making by government, industry, and the community.

Key duties and responsibilities

1. Provide technical support and to the Manager Geospatial Data Management regarding geospatial data.

2. Undertake data capture, maintenance and quality assurance activities adhering to technical specifications for geospatial

data that meet NTG specifications and national or international standards.

3. Participate in the implementation of new technologies in satellite, aerial and terrestrial imagery, geospatial data

collection, manipulation, and storage.

4. Contribute to providing timely and accurate technical advice on geospatial information.

5. Maintain effective collaborative working partnerships with key stakeholders and contractors.

6. Contribute to the development, implementation and maintenance of policy and procedures relating to geospatial data.

7. Prepare correspondence and reports for internal and external audiences including client, contractors, and management.

8. Research trends and new technologies in the geospatial products and services sector and contribute information and

input towards implementing those that add value to operations.

Selection Criteria

Essential

1. Relevant qualification awarded by an Australian institute, or equivalent; or relevant experience in a field of technical

work closely related to the duties of the position.

2. Strong knowledge of and proven experience in the capture, maintenance, and quality assurance of geospatial data.

3. Proven ability to plan and organize assigned tasks delivering a responsive service in an environment influenced by

competing priorities.

4. Demonstrated commitment to the progression of work in a collaborative manner with the ability to convey technical

information to a range of clients.

5. Demonstrated commitment to continuous improvement and resolution of issues through innovative practices.

6. Sound communication, interpersonal and negotiation skills with the ability to interact effectively with people of diverse

cultures.

Desirable

1. Knowledge of contemporary trends in geospatial data technologies and their application in addressing business needs.

G8 Education is one of Australia’s largest early education and care providers, with more than 420+ centres across Australia and over 10,000 team members who are all helping shape the lives of over 42,000 children every day. Our core values of passion, innovation, dedication, compassion, and integrity, unite us on our journey to ensure the health and happiness of future generations. We are committed to developing a culture that empowers and rewards our team of early childhood educators, teachers, leaders, and support office.
The Opportunity
We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Insights and Analytics Lead to join our Digital Solutions Team.
Reporting to the Head of Data and Analytics, this role is to provide value-added insights to the business that lead to optimal business decisions. You will be responsible for providing in-depth strategic and analytical information in the areas of operations, customer, network growth, and portfolio performance management all whilst building and maintaining reports to track key performance indicators across G8 Education. This role is based out of our Support Office in Varsity Lakes, on the Gold Coast.
Your day-to-day
No two days are the same here at G8 as we value ourselves on collaboration, teamwork, and innovation. Some of the duties you will see yourself undertaking are.
Building and implementing company-wide reports to interpret and collate data.
Generate insights across all areas of the business whilst using data analytics to identify key areas of discussion.
Undertake regular reviews of existing portfolio for demographic, economic and commercial drivers
Business partner and support Operational/Support teams to integrate new business strategy and work routines
Model data for analysis and for input into financial planning
Prepare and deliver data presentations and analytical insights to the business, including to the executive management
Continuous improvement to documentation standards and create efficiencies in reporting methodologies.
Build an understanding of the sector that underpins analytical insights against the business’ key metrics
About You
You are someone who thrives in a fast paced and engaging work environment. You value great partnerships, you’re collaborative, you always strive for excellence, and you own the outcomes. Some of the required skills and experiences to be successful in this role:
Key areas of highly desirable skills are:
5+ years' experience in data analytics
Undergraduate qualification in data analytics, mathematics, or a related discipline
Power BI Experience, Python or SQL – not essential but would be beneficial.
High levels of critical thinking and ability to problem solve with high attention to detail
High-level understanding of data and experience in extracting, integrating, manipulating, and displaying data from various systems using automation where possible
Well-developed communication/presentation skills at all levels of the business
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work well in a team and across the business
Hold, or be willing to obtain, a valid working with children check
Benefits Include:
Competitive salary package with incentivised annual bonuses.
Work From Home & Hybrid working conditions encouraged.
Flexibility to travel to both Support Office locations, Brisbane CBD and Gold Coast.
Career development opportunities as part of a large ASX-listed company
National corporate travel included to national office and services
Access a 50% discount on early education and childcare fees at any G8 Education Centre
Exclusive access to our employee benefits program covering a wide range of discounts and promotions
Dedicated focus on professional growth and development
This is a rare opportunity; if you want a diverse, challenging and personally fulfilling role, apply now!
Please note the advertising closing date is indicative only. G8 Education reserves the right to close the advertisement before this date is reached. Therefore, it is encouraged that you submit your application as soon as possible.
G8 Education is a committed advocate for child protection, safety and wellbeing. We have a zero tolerance for any form of child abuse or harm. The safety and wellbeing of children will always be our priority and all team members are expected to embrace this shared commitment. All G8 Education employees will need to hold a relevant Working with Children Check upon their commencement into the business.
Apply now

Primary objective

Utilise specialist skills to design, develop and maintain Business Intelligence (BI) solutions for client agencies of Data Services.

Context statement

This position is responsible for database views and semantic layers for a range of subject areas across the agency portfolio and

works on multiple BI developments simultaneously.

Key duties and responsibilities

1. Provide advice and support in the delivery of business intelligence solutions.

2. Design, develop and maintain business intelligence semantic layers and database views.

3. Provide professional guidance and advice to users of business intelligence systems.

4. Analyse technical specifications to ensure implementation and maintenance of semantic layers meet the reporting

requirements of agencies.

Selection criteria

Essential

1. Demonstrated experience in the design, development, and maintenance of BI semantic layers (eg SAP BI Universes, Microsoft

SQL Server Analysis Services) and database views utilising Structured Query Language (SQL).

2. Proven ability to effectively manage multiple projects simultaneously, create innovative solutions, evaluate options, achieve

successful outcomes within agreed timeframes and provide appropriate advice to senior management.

3. Demonstrated ability to use various applications and BI systems and adopt emerging technologies.

4. Demonstrated ability to contribute to a team, including working across multiple agency portfolios.

5. Developed conceptual and analytical skills and the ability to resolve problems.

6. Highly developed written, oral, and interpersonal skills and the ability to consult and collaborate effectively with a broad range

of internal and external stakeholders at all levels.

7. Proven ability to manage a high workload with changing priorities, work under pressure, prioritise commitments, coordinate

work, work independently under limited direction and meet critical timelines.

8. Demonstrated work ethic and attitude, which emulates DCDD values of being professional, accountable, honest, innovative,

and respectful.

Desirable

2. Experience with some or all of the following: SAP Business Intelligence, Microsoft SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS),

Microsoft SQL Server, SQL, and data modelling tools.

Our Why
Datacom works with organisations and communities across Australia and New Zealand to make a difference in people’s lives and help organisations use the power of tech to innovate and grow.

About the Role (your why)
The Data & Insights Consultant is responsible for developing and driving better use strategic data to drive informed decisions. The role will engage and assist with customers prior defined problems or solutions. You will be assisting in the Go-To-Market strategy and planning to drive lead generation and customer acquisition via a highly effective data and insight driven team leveraging competitive and market intelligence to inform decision making developing a clear and complete Australian market growth strategy

Our offices are based in Brisbane, Melbourne, and Sydney. We like to bring people together in person when we can, but we are mindful of the benefits of working from home for work/ life balance. We therefore leave it to you and the team you join to figure out what works best!

What you’ll do
The Data & Insights Consultant is responsible for (but not limited to):
Be part of a highly effective data and insight-driven team leveraging competitive and market intelligence to inform decisions in developing a clear and complete Australian market growth strategy
Communicate findings effectively to drive business outcomes
Collaborating with the team and actively contribute to execute strategic data collection within the market, leveraging information from both internal and external sources (including customers, analysts, etc.), to develop useful and timely insights for the development and constant refinement of the market growth strategy
Serving as the "go-to" expert for understanding strategic data sources and systems of record related to customers and the market across Datacom
Understanding and leveraging information from within and beyond the enterprise (including from customers, analysts etc) to develop useful and timely insights for the development and constant refinement of a Market growth strategy
We are a pretty agile company, and are keen to respond to customer, technology and internal stakeholders’ changing requirements and this can mean we evolve in our roles to meet those needs.

What you’ll bring
Proficiency in numerical and quantitative analysis, with a solid understanding of data interpretation, statistical methods, and the ability to make data-driven decisions
Expert knowledge in your area of consulting speciality, coupled with strong interpersonal and analytical skills
Capability with following Power Query tools: Power BI, Tableau, MS
Familiarity with relevant technologies, tools, and platforms used for data analysis, forecasting, and market research
Strong financial management practices with a clear understanding of the relationship between costs, utilisation and project revenue
Ability and experience with questioning and generating observations
Experience with creating human-friendly, technically detailed and insightful customer reports
Ability to create metrics and measurements from discrete datasets
Demonstrated understanding of planning and budgeting procedures and principles
Why join us here at Datacom?
Datacom is one of Australia and New Zealand’s largest suppliers of Information Technology professional services. We have managed to maintain a dynamic, agile, small business feel that is often diluted in larger organisations of our size. It's our people that give Datacom its unique culture and energy that you can feel from the moment you meet with us.

We care about our people and provide a range of perks such as social events, chill-out spaces, remote working, flexi-hours and professional development courses to name a few. You’ll have the opportunity to learn, develop your career, connect and bring your true self to work. You will be recognised and valued for your contributions and be able to do your work in a collegial, flat-structured environment.

We operate at the forefront of technology to help Australia and New Zealand’s largest enterprise organisations explore possibilities and solve their greatest challenges, so you will never run out of interesting new challenges and opportunities.

We want Datacom to be an inclusive and welcoming workplace for everyone and take pride in the steps we have taken and continue to take to make our environment fun and friendly, and our people feel supported.

WHY WORK FOR BELLROY?
Bellroy's mission is to inspire better ways to carry; use business as a force for good; and help the world – and our crew – flourish. Australian law firm of the year (Chambers Asia Pacific 2024): Work with the best.
Who are we?
A firm born in Asia, underpinned by world class capability.
With over 3000 lawyers in 26 global locations, we help our clients manage their risk and enable their growth. Our full-service offering combines un-matched top tier local capability.
We have deep roots in Australia spanning almost 200 years and acknowledge Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples as the traditional owners and custodians of these lands and waters.
Role Detail
With the ongoing importance we put on data protection and governance for our clients and ourselves, and to continue to generate data-informed insights that will lead to improved products and services for our clients plus support future focussed business decisions, we have created a new position to the firm as Chief Data Officer (CDO). This role will have a primary focus on Australia and Singapore.
With flexibility to be based in Sydney or Melbourne, this newly created position will play a pivotal role in shaping and leading the implementation of the firm’s data strategy, underpinned by our key data principles around collection, protection, education and governance, and guide client and firm insights.
Reporting to an empowering Chief Operating Officer, and part of the wider leadership team, this role will be responsible for:
Understanding the breadth, use and value of data across our people, clients and systems
With the partners and leaders of the firm, identifying the firm’s business decisions, client decisions or firms services that could be improved or enabled by data-driven insights
Refining and driving the development and execution of the data strategy in collaboration with key stakeholders
Collaborating with stakeholders to collect and translate data into actionable insights and strategies
Building out the data team reporting to the CDO including identifying team members from other teams currently and potentially external sourcing
Educating and empowering our people to use data responsibly and effectively
Promoting a culture of data-driven decision-making throughout the firm
Establishing and maintaining acceptable data use and compliance frameworks, standards, policies and processes
Championing data quality, integrity, and privacy across the firm that includes promoting and monitoring data management compliance with internal policies, client requirements and relevant laws and industry regulations
Overseeing the selection, deployment, and optimisation of relevant data management tools and platforms
Mentoring, coaching and developing high-performing data and insights specialists
Defining roles, responsibilities, and performance metrics for data and insights specialists, data stewards and data owners
Encouraging continuous learning, training and application of the latest data technologies and methodologies
Communicating data strategies and insights to the executive team, board, and other stakeholders
Fostering strong relationships with internal teams, stakeholders and external partners to ensure data alignment, business value and collaboration
About You
This role requires a strategic thinker and effective communicator who can engage and inspire stakeholders across the firm. With a natural curiosity and commercial lens, you will enjoy operating under a one team one firm ethos. Your ability to collaborate and educate, through an excellence without arrogance approach, will be celebrated and your analytical mindset will be rewarded. To set you up for success, you will also need:
Senior leadership experience in an information, technology, analytics, governance or related field
Demonstrated experience in extracting value from structured and unstructured data
Extensive knowledge of information systems, related software and data management, governance, enterprise content management, and record-keeping policies and practices in a complex organisational environment
Business and financial acumen with the ability to discuss issues in stakeholder language
Strong communication, influencing and negotiation skills
Ability to build effective relationships with senior managers and other key stakeholders
Ability to articulate and drive strategic outcomes aligned to business goals
