About the Role
The Business Intelligence team transforms data into actionable insights, ensuring CFA's Victorian communities are well-prepared and safe from fire. They support informed decisions by delivering high-quality, accessible data to various stakeholders, including community programs, project leaders, brigades, the media, emergency agencies, the Board and the Minister's Office.
The Senior Data Analyst manages the collection, analysis and presentation of data for key strategic initiatives aligned with CFA's Strategy and Outcomes Framework. This role focuses on data visualisation, corporate reporting or spatial analysis to provide valuable, high-quality data for decision-makers, ensuring outputs align with strategic and product goals.
Key responsibilities of the role will include the following:
Manage the product lifecycle and maintain a central repository for objectives and benefits.
Align service requests with goals and stakeholder needs.
Analyse, innovate and integrate complex data for decision-making.
Maintain expertise in risk management, spatial analysis and road networks.
Ensure data outcomes align with strategic goals and governance.
Monitor trends, validate insights and adapt business plans.
Represent CFA in external analytical communities and build industry partnerships.
Manage vendors to deliver timely services and achieve business objectives.
Provide training for product adoption and improvement.
Develop reports, integrate spatial data and manage the Victorian Fire Risk Registers.
Support fire risk assessment, community safety and apply ISO 31000 in emergency management.
Oversee map presentations, standards and contribute to State Mapping activities.
About You
Our ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate the following:
Relevant qualification with well-developed experience in the methods, techniques and tools for trusted data analyses that benefit the customers of an organisation.
Demonstrated knowledge and experience in the use of the ESRI suite of technologies such as ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Enterprise, Web mapping applications such as ArcGIS Online or VertiGIS applications for the collection and presentation of data.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills with proven ability to optimise delivery outcomes and solve dependencies across stakeholder groups to meet quarterly milestones.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with an ability to manage stakeholder and vendor relationships at senior levels and translate complex technical matters into lay terms.
Demonstrated authority as a trusted specialist that informs proposals, counsels decision makers and aligns stakeholders to product objectives

Job Title: Business Operations Support Analyst - Apple Wallet, Payments and Commerce (ANZSEA)
Job Description:
Summary

Posted: 14 Aug 2024

Weekly Hours: 38

Role Number:200563472

Apple is a place where extraordinary people gather to do their best work. If you’re excited by the idea of making a real impact and joining a team where we pride ourselves in being one of the most diverse and inclusive companies in the world, a career with Apple might be your dream job! Apple is looking for a Business Operations Support Analyst to support our Apple Pay and Wallet partners. Working within the Business Operations team, you will focus on delivering an excellent experience for Appleʼs partners in Australia, New Zealand and South East Asia (ANZSEA) as they leverage Apple Pay and Wallet to deliver services to their customers. As part of the role, you will be responsible for the Apple Pay onboarding program in ANZSEA. The program supports the onboarding of banks and financial institutions onto the Apple Pay platform. In addition to onboarding partners, you will also be working with the Business Development, Marketing and Technical teams to improve, optimise and maintain our existing partnerships. The role is based in Sydney at our Martin Place offices.

Description

- Manage the onboarding of partners onto the Apple Pay platform. This includes owning the programmatic cadence with the payment network operators to scale and improve the program, and documenting and improving processes. - Work closely with Apple Business Development, Technical, Marketing and Legal teams to improve, optimise and maintain our existing partnerships. This includes finding opportunities to improve the user experience by working with partners to reduce friction when using Wallet services. - Support existing partners with operations related enquiries. This includes supporting the enablement of new platform features and support of billing, reporting and testing activities. - Working closely with the Marketing team, you will support the review of marketing material and partner app UI and UX flows to ensure they meeting Apple standards. - Ability to analyse processes and identify improvements to processes, systems and tools. - Ability to manage by influence key relationships with cross-functional internal teams and partner organisations.
Proven track record of creating, implementing, and managing operational processes.
Experience in managing programs or partner onboarding processes across a cross-functional team.


Preferred Qualifications
Strong communication, problem solving, influencing and decision-making.
Outstanding time management, documentation and organisational skills.
Ability to collaborate with, and deliver change across, operational functions.
Ability to analyse processes and identify improvements.
Able to define processes and requirements under sometimes ambiguous conditions.
Ability to manage by influence key relationships with cross-functional internal teams and partner organisations.

We are on the hunt for an experienced and passionate Marketing Specialist to join our Growth Marketing team in this permanent position. In this role you will support the Marketing Manager with the delivery of a broad range of acquisition campaigns including offers, partnership campaigns, end-to-end acquisition campaigns, initiatives and sales support across the Consumer Portfolio.

As part of the Medibank Group, we have a huge focus on health and wellbeing. This means flexible working and continuous improvement to our ways of working. This team is currently trialling a 9 day fortnight, which means putting tools down to focus on something to improve your personal health and wellbeing one day per fortnight.

As Marketing Specialist, you will partner with stakeholders including our legal team, agencies and the wider marketing team to drive acquisition and brand growth for Medibank.

Day to day, this role would see you:
Deciding if your day is best spent working from home or the office. We don’t go for mandated office attendance here at Medibank, but we will need you to come along to team days and events when they’re on.
Managing delivery through creative studio/agency, internal builds, web updates & dispatch of assets to media agencies.
Drawing upon key insights and analysis to develop new campaign strategies and briefs that leverage our platforms and data capabilities.
Helping to drive our email test and learn program, and assisting with integration into our global lead management journeys.
Developing and delivering acquisition support documents, sales tools and collateral.
Taking some time to recharge your batteries and encouraging others to do the same – you might grab a takeaway coffee and head out for a walking one on one with a team member, get to the gym for a lunchtime class or block out calendar time to attend to your childs school assembly.
What about you?
This role would be a perfect match for an experienced, process oriented Specialist looking to grow their career in house with a large organisation - agency experience will be very highly regarded. You will need to have a proven track record in customer acquisition strategy implementation, combined with a genuine passion for data and insights.

We will need you to bring your strong end-to-end campaign delivery experience along with a willingness to learn and get on the tools. You’ll need to be a pro at pivoting – this is a fast paced environment where priorities can change quickly, so you need to be comfortable in running with new approaches. An effective communicator, you will be able to engage with a range of stakeholders to achieve great results for the business. Its essential that you have a keen eye for detail and accuracy too.

A career with us
At Medibank, we believe work is something we do, not somewhere we go. Our modes of working – Collaboration, Connection and Concentration – help inform how your day is structured and where you choose to work will vary, depending on your role and requirements.

The wellbeing of our employees is our priority. We encourage you to talk to us about any additional support you may require during the recruitment process, as well as how this role can be flexible for you. We encourage applications from candidates with a disability, if you require any adjustments or alternate formats of key information at any stage of the recruitment process, we welcome hearing from you via careers@medibank.com.au or (03) 8622 5666.

As the capital city of Western Australia, the City of Perth is a Local Government that is ambitious for the future. To achieve our aims, we recruit the very best people who understand the City exists to enable and deliver the aspirations of the community.

As a Workforce Systems and Data Specialist in the City of Perth, you will manage the key aspects of City’s Human Resources Information Management System (HRMIS), including configuration, upgrades, problem resolution, and reporting. Plays a pivotal role in supporting the delivery of the City’s new enterprise-level HRMIS, ensuring seamless integration and functionality across the organisation.
Reporting to the Chief People Officer within our People and Culture team, your responsibilities would primarily include:
Champion the People and Culture Unit’s new HRIS and oversight Unit change management initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders;
Develop and Provide City-wide training to super users, line management and new users; provide first line support to employees in use of the HRIS, particularly its self-service functions;
Design, implement, and maintain databases to optimise data storage and retrieval, use advanced analysis tools to interpret complex datasets and provide actionable insights, while ensuring the highest standards of data integrity & quality and;
Track, manage, and follow up on vendor support tickets and service requests, ensuring timely resolution and effective communication throughout the process.
About You
To succeed in this role, you will possess:
Experience in, analysing, reviewing and drafting processes with a focus on business improvement;
Experience assessing business issues and requirements; documenting in process mapping software;
Demonstrated ability to work with technical and non-technical teams and;
Developed interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills, specifically in relation to negotiating positive outcomes and promoting business improvement.
If your experience and capabilities match these criteria, we welcome your application.
Above all, you will live our values of Commitment, Teamwork, Courage and Respect that allow us to come together to lead and support the community.
Please view the attached Application Pack to learn more about the role and working at the City.

A right to work in Australia (e.g. a birth certificate, current passport or current visa); and
A satisfactory National Police Clearance (dated within 3 months).

Applicants may also be considered for similar positions within the City of Perth.
We’re continuing to build a gender-equitable team and a culture that’s just as diverse, inclusive and welcoming as the City of Perth Community. Canvassing of Elected Members during the recruitment process will disqualify your application.

What’s the role?
An exciting opportunity has become available for a Pricing & Insights Analyst to join our Consumer division. In this role, you will be an integral part of the dynamic, highly motivated Consumer Team that supports the delivery of pricing initiatives across News Corp Australia.
The role:
Support the modeling, planning, preparation and monitoring of introductory offers in a multi-channel environment. Brief, review and test offer builds and price positioning on shopfronts.
Management of audience-led pricing strategy, including; developing use cases for testing different pricing and demand hypotheses based on a deep understanding of customer behavior, managing the process to target select audiences, reporting back to key stakeholders on findings and developing optimization recommendations.
Use a variety of statistical modelling methods to prepare insights that show the potential impact of various pricing strategies, including their effect on margins and costs and how they will impact profitability and sales volume.
Track customer behaviour to develop effective pricing strategies for products and offers.
Assess data from a variety of sources and use it to derive insights into pricing strategies and market trends. Develop complex pricing models that reflect margins for promotional and seasonal pricing based on competitor, market, and customer data.
Set up test plans and determine test parameters in collaboration with key stakeholders.
Report on and communicate the status and progress of use cases at regular intervals to stakeholders.
Management of the subscription price book, including working with other stakeholders to ensure all offers are correct and current in the right channels.
Support in other pricing functions including price elasticity analysis and consumer and competitor research.
Who are you?
Who are you?
Highly analytical with a deep understanding of statistical modelling, forecasting and pricing best practice.
The ability to identify, evaluate and develop customer value management strategies and promotional tactics that optimise customer and business outcomes for subscriptions and circulation.
Translate complex data into actionable strategies and techniques to drive sales and enhance marketing efforts
High attention to detail and accuracy, working within complex environments and data sets
Understand business needs, and transform those into tangible requirements for testing
Demonstrated ability to get things done in a rapidly changing environment
Strong collaboration and communication skills
Advanced Excel skills
News Benefits
News Benefits is our way of saying thank you to our people for their valued contribution to News, our audiences, clients and communities. Thanking them for the great things they do daily, for the greater good of Australia. Our benefits include:
Exclusively ours - Access to publications and products from across the News Corp family
Health & wellbeing - Advice, support and facilities for healthy minds and bodies (including an onsite gym at our Adelaide, Brisbane & Sydney offices)
Time off - News offers a range of leave options to support your personal needs and moments that matter in life: Parental leave, Birthday leave, Volunteer leave, Career break and Compassionate leave.
Helping you grow - Development opportunities (including diversity and inclusion - focused education series) and recognition
Financial wellbeing - Support on making the most of your money
Perks & discounts - Exclusive offers across a range of products and services
Giving back - Make a difference to our communities.
Workplace Inclusion and facilities – Engage with your passions through various employee-resource groups and accessibility to multi-faith quiet rooms & parents’ rooms
Who are we?
Innovation is at the heart of everything we do, with resilience, adaptability and a team focus making our sales team the best in the business. As the country’s largest print and digital publisher, with a combined audience of 17 million Australians, we deliver growth, improved reach and “household name status” to our clients across multiple platforms.
What’s next?
Apply now or for more information on careers at News Corp Australia visit www.newscorpaustralia.com/careers
Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion We know that diversity strengthens our teams and newsrooms as we seek to tell stories that represent the diverse communities of Australia that we serve. Our people make us unique and we all have a story. We encourage people of all ages, backgrounds, races, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, abilities and gender identities to apply. Inclusion is important to us and we want everyone at News to bring their whole-selves to work. If you require any accommodations or adjustments throughout the recruitment process, or would like to outline which pronouns you prefer, please feel free to let us know.
If you require any accommodations or adjustments throughout the recruitment process, please feel free to let us know. For more information regarding Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at NewsCorp Australia please visit www.newscorpaustralia.com/careers under the DEI section.
Category:
The Australian & Prestige
We are proud to be Australia’s most impactful media group, we’re even prouder of what we stand for: Together, we inform, advocate and inspire all Australians, for a better Australia.
With over 150 brands across news, sport and lifestyle, backed by a team of more than 5,000 dedicated people across the country, News Corp Australia is trusted by over 17 million Australians a month to provide the information and inspiration they seek across multiple digital, video, audio and print platforms.
Renowned for world-class journalism and marketing services nationally and internationally, we are passionate, creative and dynamic. We offer a fast-paced environment that encourages individuals to take control of their future and challenge themselves in ever-changing fields.

Job Title: Analyst - Discovery & Data Management (Forensic Technology) | Bendigo
Job Description:
Date: 28 Aug 2024

Location:
Bendigo, VIC, AU

Department: Financial Advisory

Description:
Job Requisition ID: 35815

Technology has revolutionised the business space and is now more powerful than ever. But with great power comes great responsibility. That’s why we’re here. Part risk, part tech, we help clients protect their intellectual property and data!

Who are we?

Call us biased, but we’re probably the people with the coolest jobs at Deloitte. We help clients navigate tech risks through internal investigations and forensically analysing electronic evidence collected from phones, computers, networks, storage devices and backup systems. We work on projects that involve everything from theft of intellectual property and misuse of computer systems to detecting fraudulent activity, intentional deletion of data and tracing data breaches.

About the Digital Operations Centre
Deloitte’s Digital Operations Centre is located on La Trobe’s Flora Hill Campus in Bendigo establishing our long-term presence in Bendigo. The Digital Operations Centre is a transformational new centre within Deloitte Australia that’s focused on delivering digital services for clients across all major Australian industry sectors. The work is centred on the client servicing and transactional execution for Finance, HR and technology services.

What will your typical day look like?
We’ll be honest, it’s hard to tell you what an average day will look like at Deloitte because every day is just so different! Working on projects with an impressive portfolio of top-tier clients, you’ll get enviable experience as you:

Get exposure to tracing data breaches, intellectual property theft, misuse of computer systems and fraudulent activity (such as corruption and money laundering).
Roll up your sleeves to investigate electronic evidence collected from mobile phones, computers, networks, storage devices and backup systems.
Design solutions for engagements relating to electronic discovery, forensic investigations, legal support and digital forensics.
Explore and identify patterns in data to underpin decisions and outcomes for clients.
Track evidence and prepare detailed reports on forensic analysis findings.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you.
We know that as a student, you may not necessarily have a ton of work experience, and that’s okay! At Deloitte, we see past experience and value your potential to grow more than anything else.

You’re someone who:
Is studying or has completed a degree in Computer Science, Data Science, IT, Software Engineering, Digital Forensics or InfoSys.
Is comfortable with turning ambiguous problems and open-ended tasks into creative solutions.
Has a keen eye for detail and possesses strong communication and writing skills.
Works best collaboratively – you thrive when working in a team!
Demonstrates a high level of integrity and maintains confidentiality at all times (this is integral considering the nature of work we do!).

Why Deloitte?

At Deloitte, we focus our energy on interesting and impactful work. We’re always learning, innovating and setting the standard; making a positive difference to our clients and our society. We put coaching at the heart of what we do, helping our people grow their careers in any direction – whether it be up, moving into something new, or even moving across the world.

We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion. We have a diverse collection of people from different backgrounds, with different experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. What binds us together is a shared commitment to value everyone’s perspective and to cultivate inclusion; so that our work environment is a safe space we can all belong.

We prioritise flexibility and choice. At Deloitte, you get trust on Day 1. We know our people get their best work done when they’re in control of where and how they work, designing their work week around their client, team and personal commitments.

We help you live and work well. To support your personal and professional life, we offer a range of perks and benefits, including retail discounts, wellbeing leave, paid volunteering days, twelve flexible working options, market-leading parental leave and return to work support package.

We are looking for a BA who has demonstrated experience in business and data analysis alongside project delivery. You’ll be confident working across functional teams and will be able to join our team on a Full-time basis within one of our agencies.
As a Business Analyst, you are responsible for leading the written recommendations and documentation required throughout the project lifecycle working closely with Clients and our Project Management Office, Technical Development, Design and User Experience teams.
Who are we looking for?
2 years agency experience

The Role
The APS 6 Data Manager is accountable under limited direction, to perform and achieve data management and records management work within an integrated workforce. The role requires excellent attention to detail and the ability to work independently, responsible for day-to-day data management within our corporate tools as well as supporting the Governance and Assurance EL 1 with additional ad-hoc tasks.

The APS 6 Data Manager will:
Plan, lead and manage the day to day tasks associated with Data and Records Management within Air Defence Systems Branch (ADSB)
Liaise with internal and external stakeholders and build good working relationships as the sole POC for assistance and general enquiries
Create processes and procedures (where applicable) and maintain records management systems in line with Defence policies and procedures
Collate, interpret and present data as well as update and maintain the House of Governance (HoG) and/or SharePoint sites as a secondary function.

About our Team
The recently announced 2024 National Defence Strategy stated that Defence must deliver a layered Integrated Air and Missile Defence (IAMD) operational capability urgently which means there are exciting opportunities to work on this critically important defence capability.

As an integral part of the Air Defence Systems Branch you will be working with a highly motivated team of people who are committed to delivering this multi-billion dollar capability to the Australian Defence Force. If you enjoy flexible working conditions and embody the APS values of impartiality, commitment, accountability, respectfulness and ethics we have career opportunities for you.

Our Ideal Candidate
Air Defence Systems Branch are seeking a high-performing Data Manager who enjoys a challenge and is comfortable working with competing priorities; responding and adapting to new and changing circumstances; and maintaining strong attention to detail. You will have experience or interest in working in dynamic team environments; engaging with diverse stakeholders; using initiative solutions to solve problems and developing advice for senior Defence leaders.

You will be able to achieve timely outcomes that are beneficial to both the Branch & Program and you may be a team coach or team lead. You will have well-developed written and verbal communication skills, be self-motivated and client focused. You will have excellent interpersonal skills, ability to work well in a team environment, be accountable, and a high level of integrity.

We have a fantastic opportunity for a Business Insights Analyst located at Macquarie Park. The Business Insights Analyst supports the execution of customer facing activity, conduit between function SME and BI to ensure the end-to-end data, reporting and analytics needs of the function are aligned to Food strategic priority.

In this Role
Perform analysis in a timely manner to influence business decision-making with fact-based insights,
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand key challenges and agree on solutions using functional data to build reports, analytics, and insights.
Foster effective communication between stakeholders and Business Insights teams, ensuring a clear understanding of requirements, project timelines, and deliverables.

Support in training business users on new dashboards and tools,

Metcash is Australia’s leading wholesale distribution company, with revenue 1 exceeding $18 billion in FY23. We’re also an ASX top 100 listed company.

We believe that it is absolutely vital to Australia that there is a sustainable, independent, family-owned business sector. Independent retailers support their local communities. We help them to be the ‘Best Store in Their Town’ by providing merchandising, operational and marketing support across our food, liquor and hardware pillars.

ASIS is Australia’s overseas secret intelligence collection agency. Its mission is to protect and
promote Australia’s vital interests through the provision of intelligence services as directed by the
Australian Government. Its work can involve collecting intelligence relating to national security,
international relations and economic issues. It also contributes to Australia’s coordinated national
efforts against terrorism, proliferation of weapons of mass destruction, and trans-national issues
such as people smuggling.
ASIS employs people in a wide range of roles, including technologists. These roles require dynamic
team players who enjoy working with stakeholders, team members and individually on projects.
ASIS is looking for people who will be able to meet tight deadlines and work to support ASIS
priorities. Sucessful candidates will have excellent coordination and administration skills, excellent
verbal and written communication skills; and, strong stakeholder engagement and influencing
skills. Relevant tertiary qualifications and demonstrable experience will be highly regarded.
ASIS values workplace diversity and is committed to providing a supportive, inclusive and
respectful work environment. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander
People, women, people with disabilities, people that identify as LGBTIQ+ and people from culturally
and linguistically diverse backgrounds.
We offer a competitive salary package including 22 days annual leave, shutdown between
Christmas and New Years Day, 15.4% employer superannuation contribution, access to flex time
(up to Level 6 only) and generous paid parental leave. Full and part time positions as well as flexible
work hours can be negotiated.
All positions are office-based and located in Canberra. This role requires the successful applicant
to obtain and maintain a Security Clearance.
Role: Data Governance and Compliance Officer (Level 5 and Level 6)
This role works under the direction of the Manager of ASIS Data Governance and Compliance to
provide advice to specialist teams within ASIS in relation to compliance, legal and privacy
obligations regarding data. The officer will work independently and under the guidance of the
manager to: draft high-level policy and guidance documents, contribute to bespoke training, assist
in compliance matters, undertake auditing, coordinate input into data management systems as
required, and draft Memorandums of Understanding on specialist matters as required. They will
also attend and participate in various working groups and forums as they pertain to data
governance and/or compliance, maintaining relationships with key stakeholders from other
agencies.
Key Responsibilities and Tasks

Outlined below are the key areas of responsibility for the Data Governance and Compliance Officer:
Provide compliance advice to specialist teams in relation to data-related matters
Possess a thorough understanding of the relevant legislation, privacy rules and associated
documentation underpinning data matters
Draft, review and update (when required) compliance policy and guidance documents to
address any emerging needs and requirements
Contribute to bespoke training courses and presentations on compliance and/or
governance matters, by way of content development and/or as a presenter if required
Liaise with key stakeholders from other agencies to ensure any external compliance
requirements are being addressed, as well as ensuring consistent and best compliance
and governance practice across the intelligence community
Contribute to the development of MOUs, addressing any associated compliance issues
Assist with compliance matters as they arise, ensuring stakeholder actions are completed
in a timely manner
Undertake audits of data-related activities and draft reports based on findings
Coordinate input as required, into data management systems
Core Skills / Education, qualification and experience requirements
One or more of the following:
Knowledge, or aptitude for, legislative, privacy and compliance issues associated with data
use
Ability to provide compliance advice to specialist teams
Well-developed oral and written communication skills
Strong interpersonal skills and strong ability to work as a team member under the direction
of a Manager
Ability to represent ASIS across government and internationally, as appropriate
Ability to exercise judgement & show resilience in compliance & governance issues
associated with data matters
Experience in the following would be beneficial, but not essential:
Demonstrated Knowledge of the Intelligence Services Act 2001.
Previous experience in the National Intelligence Community.
Selection Criteria
Candidates are not required to provide a separate written response to the ILS capabilities (below),
however, candidates are encouraged to consider the capabilities in preparing their application, as
each candidate will be assessed on their ability to demonstrate behaviours aligned to the
capabilities for the position.
For more information on the ILS, tips on applying for jobs in the Public Service, go to the APSC
website found at www.apsc.gov.au.
Supports Strategic Direction
Supports shared purpose and direction;
Thinks strategically;
Harnesses information and opportunities; and
Shows judgment, intelligence and common sense.
Achieves Results
Identifies and uses resources wisely;
Applies and builds professional expertise;
Responds positively to change; and
Takes responsibility for managing work projects to achieve results.
Supports Productive Working Relationships
Nurtures internal and external relationships;
Listens to, understands and recognises the needs of others;
Values individual differences and diversity; and
Shares learning and supports other.
Displays Personal Drive and Integrity
Demonstrates public service professionalism and probity;
Engages with risk and shows personal courage;
Commits to action;
Promotes and adopts a positive and balanced approach to work; and
Demonstrates self-awareness and a commitment to personal development.
Communicates with Influence
Communicates clearly;
Listens, understands and adapts to audience; and
Negotiates confidently.
Job Specific Requirements
Demonstrated experience and education relevant to the role.

HOW TO APPLY
Applicants will need to apply ONLINE via our website.
Applicants will required to attach a resume and submit a maximum 800 word pitch outlining their
relevant experience, skills and knowledge to perform the duties of the role.
You will be asked what level you are applying for.
Applicants are encouraged to consider the capabilities when preparing their application, as this
will form the basis of selection assessment. For more information and tips on applying for jobs in
the Public Service, search ‘Joining the APS’ at www.apsc.gov.au.
After application submission, you may receive an SMS requesting you to complete online testing.
Please ensure you complete this as your application will not be progressed otherwise.
APPLICATIONS CLOSE: Refer to date on website
ELIGIBILITY
Candidates must be Australian citizens.
The successful candidate will be required to obtain and maintain a security clearance.
REASONABLE ADJUSTMENTS
All requests for reasonable adjustments will be considered and managed in consultation with you.
We will continue to ask you if you require reasonable adjustments at each stage of the process.
If you are successful in gaining employment, reasonable adjustments can also be made available
to you in performing your role.
WHAT HAPPENS NEXT?

this as your application will not be progressed otherwise.
Please do not tell anyone about your application with our organisation at this stage of the process
as doing so may harm your suitability for employment with us.
A merit list will be established for candidates who are suitable and will remain valid for a period
of 18 months.
We thank you for the time and effort you have put into your application; however, we are
unfortunately unable to provide feedback to unsuccessful candidates.

Job Title: APS 6 - Business Capability Evaluation and Testing Analyst
Job Description:
$91,702 - $104,753 (pro-rata for part-time vacancies) + up to 15.4% Superannuation
Fairbairn - ACT


The Role
Do you enjoy looking at the big picture and working with others?
Are you passionate about identifying where Defence’s business can be improved?

We are seeking a meticulous and strategic Business Capability Evaluator and Tester to join the Defence Business Integration Program team. This role is crucial in ensuring that our business processes, business systems, and capabilities meet optimal efficiency, effectiveness, and alignment with organisational goals.

This is not your typical test and evaluation role, where you’re testing physical things or technologies. It’s about supporting testing of end to end business processes.

Your key responsibilities include:
Assessing and evaluating business processes, and systems to identify strengths, weaknesses, and areas for improvement;
Assisting business areas to develop and execute test plans and scenarios to validate business capabilities and functionalities;
Coordinating evaluation and testing across the Defence Business Integration Program;
Documenting and summarising testing procedures, findings, and recommendations in clear and concise reports;
Conducting cross-program gap analysis and recommending solutions to optimise business processes and systems;
Collaborating with stakeholders to understand business requirements and expectations;
Providing insights and recommendations to senior management for enhancing business capabilities and achieving strategic objectives;
Staying informed about industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies related to business capability testing and evaluation.

About our Team
The Defence Business Integration Program (DBIP) is modernising how Defence does business. It facilitates transformation of enabling business capabilities that support Defence agility and preparedness.

The DBIP is managed by a small branch, currently consisting of 4 Directorates. One of those Directorates is the Capability Realisation and Assurance Directorate.We are a small team of passionate people who understand that improving business capability takes more than just new technology.

We are developing a holistic approach to improving business capability that considers people, process, organisational structure, data and technology. We not only help our constituent projects out by ensuring they consider all of these elements, we also identify and implement change initiatives that sit above or across projects.

We work closely together so that we can leverage each other’s skills and experience and engage widely with stakeholders to understand the broader environment and identify practical initiatives to improve business capability.

Our Ideal Candidate
Our ideal candidate will enjoy working with people across the Defence enterprise to analyse challenging and highly complex capabilities.

They will be able to synthesise information from multiple sources to identify common risks and issues revealed through evaluation and testing. They will be able to think outside the box when it comes to how Defence can evaluate and test business capability.

The Role
Covetrus is a global animal health organisation providing a range of integrated services which drive improved clinical and financial outcomes for vets and pet owners. We have a long history of innovation, continuous improvement, and excellence in customer service to our vet and veterinary practice clients. In Australia and New Zealand, the company trades under the name Provet, a brand with a rich 40 year heritage and strong trust in the veterinary community.
We are currently seeking a procurement administration professional to join our Category Management & Brand Strategy team on a full time, permanent basis at Erskine Park. You will work closely with our Category Managers to ensure correct product master data including product pricing and vendor data management is maintained, as well as overseeing data governance and providing operational support to on all procurement related processes and system issues.
You will enjoy a role with variety and challenge as you interact with various parts of our diverse business and will gain exposure to a fast paced, global organisation that can provide great career opportunities and the opportunity to make a difference within the rewarding animal health industry. This role would suit an administration or customer service professional that has animal or human health industry experience OR a vet nurse/practice manager looking to transition out of clinic but remain in the animal health industry.
You will be responsible for the below across ANZ:
Product master data management including reviewing data for accuracy, code creation, and maintenance of current product codes.
Vendor data management including liaising with vendors on purchase order data issues, updating of vendor details, setting vendors up on the preferred freight carrier portal and assisting vendors with booking of freight consignments.
Pricing management including liaising with our internal teams on purchase order price issues, responding to queries from the customer service team, maintaining sales and purchasing quantity breaks, and setting up promotions to drive revenue.
General duties including liaising with finance to review/approve vendor price discrepancies, maintenance of the national mailbox, supporting category reporting requirements and other administrative duties.
About You
Our ideal candidate will bring:
Demonstrated experience in the master data management function will be essential. Although we have a bespoke ERP system at Provet, experience in SAP or other comparable platforms is critical.
Demonstrated proficiency in MS Excel and exposure to working with a range of data.
Superb attention to detail and excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Well-developed interpersonal, negotiation and influencing skills to liaise with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders including procurement, sales, category/product management and marketing.
Ability to collaborate across geographically diverse teams (Australia & NZ).
Experience with a PIM/PXM system such as Salsify, Amplifi or comparable platforms will be highly regarded.
Why Join Us?
At Covetrus, we’re proud of our family friendly culture and respectful workplace. We embrace diversity in our workforce and encourage applications from like-minded persons from all walks of life. Covetrus team members are eligible to access a suite of fantastic benefits, to help them look after themselves, their family and their beloved pets. These include –
Generous discounts on our range of animal health food & enrichment products
Access to Perkbox/Boost apps for discounts on everyday shopping & amazing health & wellbeing resources.
Additional leave benefits – annual birthday leave, paid parental leave, & the option to purchase additional leave
Flexible hybrid Work From Home options & dog-friendly offices (select roles and locations)
Free 24/7 access to our Employee Assistance Program
Reward & recognition through our quarterly Values Awards and our Service Anniversary Awards
Professional development through our Leadership Development & Emerging Leadership courses
Access to annual flu vaccinations
Annual volunteer days
Covetrus is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

EL 1 - $120,290 - $129,379 per annum plus superannuation
Australian Antarctic Division
Kingston, TAS
Who we are
The Australian Antarctic Division (AAD) is part of the Commonwealth Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water. As primary agency for Australia's Antarctic Program (AAP), the AAD is responsible for achieving the Australian Government's Antarctic goals. These goals are to:
Maintain the Antarctic Treaty System and enhance Australia's influence within it.
Protect the Antarctic environment.
Understand the role of Antarctica in the global climate system.
Undertake scientific work of practical, economic and national significance.
The AAD also has responsibility for administering the Australian Antarctic Territory and the Territory of Heard Island and McDonald Islands.

The AAD Science Branch leads, conducts and supports a world class program of scientific research and environmental management, consistent with national priorities through the Australian Antarctic Science Strategic Plan. The branch provides research and advice to support Australia’s Antarctic policy objectives, including participation in the Antarctic Treaty system and other international committees, commissions and intergovernmental panels. It manages and administers the Australian Antarctic Science Program and provides scientific and research advice to support regulatory and management decisions.

The branch provides advice for Antarctic capability projects, conducts impact assessments and develops and implements strategies to address environmental legacies while undertaking targeted outreach promoting the value of Australian Antarctic science. The responsibilities of the Science Branch are diverse as we lead the Australian Government’s scientific program in Antarctica. Our research addresses critical issues including climate change, the human footprint in Antarctica, and the conservation of Antarctic and Southern Ocean wildlife. Our diverse research program covers physical and life sciences in the atmosphere, terrestrial and marine domains.

The Environmental Stewardship Program (ESP), within the Science Branch, is a multidisciplinary program that conducts scientific research and implements evidence-based conservation, environmental management, environmental assessments, remediation and mitigation actions in Antarctica and the sub-Antarctic. The program collaborates closely across the AAD to deliver an “actionable Cleaner Antarctica Strategy” for Australian stations, as well as scientific, environmental management and policy outcomes. Key to meeting Australia’s Environmental Stewardship goals is the coordinated use and visualisation of available data to inform evidence based environmental management, planning and policy decisions.

As such, a Geospatial Environmental Management System (GEMS) will be developed and maintained for the collation, display and interrogation of spatial, environmental and station data at and adjacent to Australian Antarctic stations and field camps. For use by all work areas across the AAD, GEMS will enhance the AAD’s ability to minimise and mitigate localised impacts on Antarctica’s unique biodiversity, wilderness and heritage values and support positive environmental outcomes in the planning of on-going operations, new capabilities, redevelopment, decommissioning and remediation at stations and the surrounding environment. The development of GEMS is a key objective of the Australian Antarctic Strategy and 20 Year Action Plan (2022 update).

The Job
The Environmental Data Analyst will be responsible for leading a range of data, database, GIS and data visualisation needs of the Environmental Stewardship Program and Science Branch, with primary responsibility for the data management and systems, implementation and management of GEMS.

Duties, tasks and responsibilities include:
Planning, design, implementation, and maintaining usability of environmental and geospatial data sets, databases, information systems, data visualisation and graphical user interfaces to support best practice environmental stewardship in Antarctica and across the Australian Antarctic program. This includes:
Liaising with stakeholders to determine application requirements.
Developing applications or modifying the functionality of existing systems.
This includes development (including coding) and testing, release, training and support for the on-going use of GEMS.
Consolidation and QA/QC of relevant historical and current datasets, including liaising with internal and external Australian Antarctic Division stakeholders including Policy and Strategy, Science, Operations and Logistics, Assets and Technology branches and research partners to ensure a broad range of data types and end-user needs are met.
Ensuring that data and associated systems are actively integrated, managed and maintained, including promotion of appropriate data standards, validation and QA/QC.
Working to independently specify and evaluate solutions.
Documenting, administering, and maintaining the resulting application.
Strategic engagement and collaboration with internal and external stakeholders to communicate relevant technical capabilities and emerging opportunities in the areas of scientific application development and data management that support Environmental Stewardship.
Working in conjunction with the Australian Antarctic Data Centre and the Integrated Digital East Antarctic Program to ensure that GEMS, as a key spatial tool for sustainable environmental planning and management, takes advantage of synergies with the Integrated Digital East Antarctica Program, including sharing of resources and relevant data and data products.
Being a positive team member, and at times, leader of seasonal field programs (whether in Antarctica or from Kingston), leading technical training, field sampling, data gathering, and environmental monitoring at the AAD’s sub-Antarctic and Antarctic stations.
Engaging widely, with advanced skills, to develop and maintain excellent relations with a diverse group of collaborative partners and stakeholders throughout the AAD and with external partners to deliver on environmental stewardship priorities.
Supervision of a small team, promoting diversity and inclusion, performance management, enabling continued employee development and training, and promoting and preserving an inclusive and safe workplace.
Supporting other data, database, GIS and data visualisation needs of the Environmental Stewardship Program, Science Branch and AAD as required.
What we are looking for
Knowledge and experience
Minimum 5 years experience in software development with specific experience (scientific or technical) in, and understanding of, a range of spatial environmental data and imagery (examples may include soil, water, and vegetation data, digital surface models etc), including QAQC and maintaining data quality standards.
Experience in the development and delivery of scientific data management applications, sample management and spatial information systems, and displaying raster and vector-based data through user friendly web systems.
Extensive experience in the management of scientific data, large scientific databases and/or use of spatial information systems and interfaces.
Demonstrated methodical approach to sample handling, data acquisition, and QA/QC requirements.
Demonstrated experience in data analysis, interpretation and presentation using a range of software and techniques.
Experience in the coding, testing, release, training, and support.
Skills and capabilities
Proven advanced experience developing and operating databases to process and interpret complex sets of data.
Experience managing non-standard chemical and biological environmental data sets relevant to applied research and implementation of human impacts and remediation science is highly beneficial.
Skill in strategically planning, designing (specification development) and delivery of spatial databases, GIS systems and user interfaces. This includes skills in software, database and user interface development, and ideally includes experience in integrating and displaying a variety of spatial environmental data.
Proven capability to communicate and liaise with multiple stakeholders and end users (e.g. scientists, managers and regulators).
Ability to communicate with influence (flexible, relevant, context based) with a diverse range of audiences.
Demonstrated ability to observe, adjust and learn in order to contribute to a positive and inclusive team culture, and a safe and equitable workplace.
A strong science background is critical.
Please note that the successful applicant may be required to travel to the Antarctic and sub-Antarctic regions therefore they may be required to meet specific medical, adaptability and personal qualities requirements appropriate to working in those environments. In order to undertake travel to the Antarctic & sub-Antarctic regions they will need to:
Demonstrate the range of personal qualities and interpersonal skills necessary to perform as a successful team member within isolated Antarctic and sub-Antarctic environments.
Demonstrate an ability to effectively adapt and respond to the demands of living and working in an isolated and confined environment as determined by a psychological (adaptability) assessment.
Be certified as fit for Antarctic service by the AAD’s Polar Medicine Unit.
Mandatory Qualifications
A relevant qualification from an Australian tertiary institution, or a comparable overseas institution, or demonstrated equivalent experience.
Eligibility and other requirements
Citizenship - To be eligible for employment with the Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water you must be an Australian citizen.

Security Clearance - This position requires a Baseline Vetting security clearance. You will be required to obtain and maintain a clearance at this level.

Pre-employment Check - Your suitability for employment will be assessed through a pre-employment screening process. This process includes a requirement to undergo and satisfy a National Police Check, referee checks, character clearance and where required a pre-employment medical assessment, specified mandatory qualification(s) validation and a probation period of 6 months.

For additional information, please read the Job Description below.

Join this community-based organisation and make a genuine difference to our community in the Heart of Australia!

This is a rewarding role where you will truly make a difference in the lives of our remote communities, providing the chance to experience real job satisfaction every day and play an important role in Anyinginyi’s drive to be a provider of high quality holistic Primary Health Care services to the Aboriginal communities of the Barkly region in a culturally responsive way - don't miss out!
You will be joining a friendly and professional team, where you will receive personal and professional development opportunities from an employer who wants to provide optimum working conditions!

About us
Anyinginyi Health Aboriginal Corporation (AHAC) is a multi-disciplinary organisation which provides primary health care services to the Aboriginal people of Tennant Creek and the surrounding Barkly region, dedicated to ‘Closing the Gap’ in Aboriginal health within remote Australia.

Anyinginyi consists of different sections (Health Services, Business Services, Public Health Unit and Piliyintinji-Ki Stronger Families) which allow them to have a holistic approach to health ensuring that clients' physical and emotional health and wellbeing is given the utmost priority.

Anyinginyi's mission is to be a provider of high quality holistic primary health care services featuring prevention and treatment in the Barkly region in a culturally responsive way.

About the Tennant Creek Region
Year-round blue skies, stunning landscapes and vibrant, diverse and warm communities - that's life in the Northern Territory! Only a short flight from most Australian cities, Tennant Creek is not just a must-see destination renowned for its individual identity and rich cultural heritage but is a remarkable community to set up home in!
500km north of Alice Springs, Tennant Creek was once a rough and tumble droving town but is now a modern town and one of the Territory's most populated areas. It is home to a major regional hospital, a university, schools, shops and a supermarket, accommodation, bars, clubs and restaurants, banking facilities, sporting clubs and an airport - everything you need to set up a relaxing new lifestyle! People from all walks of life find themselves calling Tennant Creek home

About the Role
The Data and Research Officer has a key role in the formation and implementation of AHAC’s data governance framework, policy, and standards to ensure compliance with the external legal, regulatory and governance environment in the health sector.
This includes developing, promoting and embedding data governance policies, procedures, standards, guidelines, and related documentation across the organisation; and developing data presentations for Staff, Management and Board.

More specifically, some of your duties will include (but will not be limited to):
General:
Undertake report building and data analysis as required.
Create and present quality reports and data flows to support ongoing reports.
Prepare standardised data sets to support analytics.
Collect and collate data from training and health care services at different levels of the healthcare system.
Contribute to data aggregation and analysis processes to ensure information is safely managed and shared appropriately.
Consider population diversity and health inequality and apply culturally relevant and ethical approaches when identifying population health needs.
Work to agreed priorities, outcomes, time constraints and assigned resources.
Oversee projects and be the lead with a range of different stakeholders.
Support the research committee.
Support the management of the research plan.
Perform other duties as request by your line manager that are reasonably within your capacity and capability.

About you

To be successful in this role, you will need to possess the following:
Essential skills and experience:
Experience in creating live reports and dashboards, insights analysis, and supporting the creation of new data models.
Developed analytical, investigation and translational skills, including those required to work with the business to create performance and outcomes measurement reports.
Experience in working with and interpreting health or health-related data (including mental health, and preferably health service and/or outcome data).
Experience in quantitative data collection, analysis, and interpretation, including presentation of outcomes in Microsoft Office suite of packages.
Knowledge and understandings of research designs and data collection methods used in health research.
Highly developed report writing skills and interpersonal skills.

Desirable
Qualifications in Health Sciences, with focus in Health service systems, data research or similar major.
Experience in an Aboriginal community controlled primary health care environment.

Please note:
A National Police Clearance and Ochre Card (NT Working with Children’s) card obtainment is a requirement prior to commencement in this role. Please refer to NT Safe for further information.
All Anyinginyi Health Aboriginal Corporation employees must be Fully Vaccinated against COVID-19.

If you meet the above criteria and you’re interested in contributing to an organisation where you can really make a difference in our local community, we want to hear from you!

Job Title: EL 2 - (S&T Level 6) - Director Research Data and Information
Job Description:
$134,567 - $161,521 + up to 15.4% Superannuation
Edinburgh - SA, Fishermans Bend - VIC


The Role
Join us as the Director of Research Data and Information at DSTG!

You will be responsible for the delivery of specialist tools, services and resources to support the needs of Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG) researchers. Leading a team of geographically distributed Library and ICT professionals, you will grow and embed research data services; oversee selection, access and discovery of scholarly information resources and collaborate on the management and discovery of specialised, classified DSTG publications.

You’ll work across broader Defence on data initiatives, including implementation of the Defence Data Strategy and partner across DSTG to develop user-focused solutions to improve researcher access to tools and infrastructure.

As part of the DSTG Team, you will play an important role in uplifting treatment of data in both the broader information environment and in bespoke solutions for research.

Duties include:
Oversee innovation, development and delivery of DSTG research data and information tools and services.
Oversee innovation, development and delivery of research data and information literacy training.
Manage the Research Data and Information team, functions and budget.
Engage with Defence-wide Data initiatives and represent DSTG as required.
Lead sharing, where possible, of DSTG innovation and discovery in research data and information management in both academic/research and professional/technical outlets (e.g. peer reviewed conference papers or journal articles).
Engage and collaborate with peers in related Publicly Funded Research Agencies.
Contribute to the ongoing development and evolution of DSSC capabilities and culture.

About our Team
The Research Data and Information (RDI) team supports DSTG by managing research data and information as a strategic asset, enabling it to be discoverable, reproducible and reusable. Importantly, RDI aims to provide services aligned with Defence Innovation, Science and Technology research needs, working collaboratively with researchers and using technology to enable these services.

RDI delivers guidance and services in the following areas:
Research data management advice and planning support.
Research information services (literature searches, digital and limited print resource management, document delivery).
Scalable training offerings (online inductions and tailored training for researchers).
Research collaboration and benchmarking analytics (including bibliometric analyses).
A research partnering team – working directly with researchers.

Our Ideal Candidate
Our ideal candidate will have expert knowledge of the research information environment including deep understanding of the research lifecycle and Science and Technology scholarly communication; trends and issues in research data and information management solutions, technologies and methods; contemporary approaches to metadata, information description, tagging and discoverability; information and data literacy; and researcher capability uplift and engagement.

We are seeking a leader who has demonstrated capabilities in persuasive written and verbal communication, collaboration, boundary spanning and strategic thinking. Post graduate qualifications in library, information, and data management or computer science will be highly desirable.

The proven ability to manage key stakeholder interests while at the same time managing conflicting priorities and business interests.

Strong communicator at all levels with excellent oral and written skills to a variety of audiences.

Iconic Australian owned and operated global retail business

Hybrid role with a vibrant team culture where we embrace pace, encourage new ideas & leadership

Spotlight Retail Group is searching for a results-oriented Business Intelligence Specialist with front end and back end development experience within Power BI
As a Business Intelligence Specialist, you will be instrumental in transforming raw data into actionable insights. Your expertise in Power BI, both front-end and back-end, will be essential in delivering world-class reporting solutions.

Here's What Awaits You
Master Power BI: Design, develop, and optimize interactive dashboards and reports. Ensure optimal performance through expert use of Power Query, DAX, and Power BI Service.
Data-Driven Insights: Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs, gather data, and create tailored reports. Perform rigorous data quality checks to guarantee accuracy and reliability.
Data Integration Expert: Seamlessly integrate data from diverse sources into Power BI. Work closely with data engineers and analysts to optimize data pipelines and reporting processes.
Performance Optimization: Fine-tune Power BI solutions for speed and efficiency. Implement best practices to enhance user experience and maximize the value of insights.
Knowledge Sharing: Empower users through comprehensive training and support. Troubleshoot issues and ensure seamless report consumption.
Strategic Partner: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision making. Contribute to the evolution of the BI landscape, including migrations to HANA and Snowflake.
Documentation and Standardization: Create clear and concise documentation for reports, dashboards, and processes. Drive reporting simplification and standardization across the organization.

What We Are Looking For
Power BI Mastery: Proven expertise in Power BI administration, development, and design, including data modelling, reporting, and dashboard creation.
Data Architecture: Strong foundation in database systems, SQL, and ETL processes with experience in tools like AWS Glue, DBT, and SSIS.

Data Modelling: Demonstrated ability to create and implement universal semantic layers in complex data environments.

Platform Expertise: Hands-on experience with leading data platforms such as Snowflake, SAP BW on HANA, and Oracle.

What’s in it for you?
We pride our self on providing our team members incredible career- growth and opportunities as part of the Spotlight Group team, we can offer you:

Career progression, personal development, and mentoring
A culture that rewards initiative and creativity
Benefits – Discounts across all brands, EAP, Gym Membership Discounts and more

Who We Are
Spotlight Group Holdings (SGH) is a privately held $3bn+ Australian parent company which controls, operates and invests in a diverse set of businesses and assets.
Comprising of the long term existing iconic brands in Spotlight, Anaconda and Mountain Designs, together with the exciting addition of Harris Scarfe, SRG is acknowledged as the market leaders within the Australian retail Space.

THE ROLE:
The Manager of Data Management and Analytics reports to the Chief Data Officer and is responsible for developing and managing Austrade’s data assets on Austrade’s Enterprise Data Platform, a cloud-based analytical environment. The role involves leading a specialised team of data professionals responsible for the technical aspects of data management, including data engineering, data science, and the development of business intelligence products. The Manager will collaborate with various business areas across the agency to deliver an ongoing work program to support business needs.

The Manager will need to balance immediate operational needs with strategic initiatives aimed at enhancing the organisation's data capabilities. The work of the team includes designing and implementing data pipelines, and developing analytical tools and products that enable data-driven insights. The Manager will also support the Chief Data Officer in fostering a culture of data quality and reliability, ensuring that all data assets are managed according to best practices and industry standards.

DUTIES INCLUDE:
Lead and manage a team of data engineers, data analysts, and Power BI developers.
Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines, data warehouses, and data lakes.
Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and security across the organisation.
Implement data management strategies and best practices.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand and address data needs.
Develop and deploy business intelligence tools and reports.
Drive continuous improvement in data processes and methodologies.
Support efforts to increase data maturity within the organisation.
Ensure data projects are delivered on time, within scope, and with high quality.
Provide technical expertise and mentorship to team members.

TEAM COLLABORATION:
Work closely with the Data Front Door and Data Governance team to ensure alignment on data governance policies and strategies.
Align with colleagues in Digital responsible for maintenance of data infrastructure.
Collaborate on the development and implementation of data products, such as visualisations and reports, ensuring they meet technical and governance standards.

Given our commitment to diversity and inclusion, Austrade actively encourages applications from people with disabilities, LGBTQIA+ people, women, and people with diverse linguistic and cultural backgrounds for all of our roles.

Job description:
Assist DSS in gaining a deeper understanding of its service delivery by analysing current and future performance, as well as historical projections. This will involve evaluating financial and non-financial data, monitoring usage trends, creating visual representation tools, and supporting the implementation of important projects. You will collaborate with a highly skilled group of service management professionals and receive ongoing guidance and support to enhance your professional growth.
Having a diverse workforce that represents the wider Tasmanian community is very important to us and we actively encourage applications from people with disabilities, from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, people who may identify as LGBTQI+, and all genders. We recognise the value, unique skills and knowledge that Aboriginal employees bring to the workplace and welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal people.
We are committed to putting the rights and wellbeing of children and young people at the centre of what we do. We will employ the right people. We will embed a culture of self-reflection and continuous improvement. We will have the courage to change what needs to be changed. We will regularly review our policies and structures through a child and youth safety lens. Our people will be equipped with the skills to recognise and respond to signs of harm. We are growing a culture where everyone takes responsibility, shares information, and speaks up if something doesn’t seem right. Together, we’re creating a place where all children and young people are safe from harm.
We support reasonable adjustment requests in any stage of the assessment process to remove barriers and facilitate full participation in all aspects of employment for applicants. If you have individual requirements that need to be accommodated in order to participate in an interview or recruitment activity, please inform the contact person listed for this vacancy.
We understand that people have different needs to manage their work and life and to support people we embrace the benefits of flexible working arrangements. Talk to us about how this could work for you.
Period of Appointment
24 months
Hours per fortnight
73.5 hours - flexible options available.

Duties
Undertake in-depth analysis of metrics such as usage patterns, customer feedback, and performance metrics, as well as any other relevant data, in order to identify patterns, trends, and areas of concern, and hence to provide specialist support and develop recommendations for improving service delivery.
Present findings and recommendations in a variety of formats depending on the audience including reports, dashboards, presentations, meetings using data visualization tools (eg Power BI).
Support continuous improvement of DSS services through the identification of areas for improvement, measuring impact of improvements, prioritising improvements and influencing the skills development of service delivery staff.
Undertake operational functions as required to support quality assurance, audit, billing, reporting and benchmarking processes related to DSS service delivery and service and product lifecycle management.
Liaise, consult and where necessary represent DSS with stakeholders, including Agencies and other customers, via meetings, surveys, working groups and user testing and training.
